title: Video Analyst
description: We are looking for a <strong>Video Analyst</strong> to join our Data Analytics department in our <strong>Chicago, IL USA</strong> <strong>Office</strong>.<p><br></p>The Video Analyst will play a key role in contributing to the department’s research and insights and help to connect tactical and technical video analysis with data.<p><br></p><strong>Who We Are</strong><p><br></p>We are one of the most famous clubs in world football, with a rich heritage and history of success – read more about our history, here.<p><br></p>Beyond that, we are passionate about our local community and, behind the scenes, we have a wide variety of opportunities and career paths for all. We have a very defined purpose: to act for a winning team, culture and community. We achieve this by ensuring we are courageous in the pursuit of progress, we champion our community and each other, and that we do the right thing (even when no one is looking).<p><br></p><strong>Your day-to-day </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Video analysis of Soccer matches.</li><li>Collaborating with the wider team to connect tactical and technical video analysis with data.</li><li>Working with video and data analysis software (proprietary and commercial) to collect and analyze data.</li><li>Contributing to analytics projects.</li><li>Delivery of timely, reliable and high-quality video analysis reports.</li><li>Collaborating with the Arsenal Data Analytics department in the UK.</li></ul><p><br></p><em>As the department is geo-distributed, this role also requires remote collaboration with colleagues in the UK time zone and across the continental US, which may occasionally fall outside normal US Central Time business hours. </em><p><br></p><strong>What We Are Looking For</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Deep knowledge of soccer either as a collegiate player or as an invested supporter.</li><li>Passion for soccer, data, and analytics.</li><li>Sharp eye for detail in a fast-paced environment.</li><li>Quick and self-driven learner.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills.</li><li>Legally able to work in the United States of America and travel to the United Kingdom.</li><li>Experience with tactical analysis, e.g. writing for an analytical or tactical soccer blog or website (Desirable).</li><li>Experience with data collection, analysis, and presentation (Desirable).</li><li>Experience with basic data analysis using R, Python or Tableau (Desirable).</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Why choose us </strong><p><br></p>At Arsenal, we want everyone to feel a sense of trust and belonging, so we are proud of both our club values and also what we offer to our employees. As one of our Gunners, you will receive:<p><br></p><ul><li>An exciting reward and recognition scheme </li><li>Generous holiday allowance which increases with your length of service </li><li>Great internal learning and development programmes </li><li>A flexible hybrid working model</li><li>A competitive health and wellbeing benefits package</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Arsenal for Everyone</strong><p><br></p>Arsenal for Everyone is our commitment to promoting and embracing equality, diversity and inclusion, so that everyone connected to the club feels like they belong to the same Arsenal family. We believe that diversity of background, skills and experience drives our success on and off the pitch. <p><br></p><em><strong>Disability Confident Leader</strong></em><p><br></p>We are a Disability Confident Leader. We actively welcome applications from people with disabilities and long-term health conditions. If you need disability-related adjustments to the recruitment process, please indicate this in your application.<p><br></p>If you are likely to meet the definition of being a ‘disabled person’ according to the Equality Act 2010, we will offer you an interview if you meet the minimum criteria for a role. Please choose the option of a guaranteed interview on your application form. The information you share with us about your health or disability will not be used in recruitment decisions.

If you need disability-related adjustments to the recruitment process, please indicate this in your application.<p><br></p>If you are likely to meet the definition of being a ‘disabled person’ according to the Equality Act 2010, we will offer you an interview if you meet the minimum criteria for a role. Please choose the option of a guaranteed interview on your application form. The information you share with us about your health or disability will not be used in recruitment decisions.

title: Data Analyst (19-22/hr)
description: <ul><li>Looking for:* *-Proficient in Excel (Highly proficient skills: create spreadsheets, formulas, Vlook ups and pivot tables is a plus)* *-2-4 years of data heavy position* *-HS Diploma or GED*</li><li>Hours:* Monday through Friday</li><li>8am to 5pm* 2 days in office, 3 days remote</li><li>Description:* The new business job family roles will be responsible for the retrieval, validation, and processing of all worksite and group benefit enrollment files and manual production submissions inclusive of file balancing and audits. The team will be responsible for accurate processing of new enrollments, routing of benefit changes, and handling of termination notifications. Job responsibilities:</li><li>Ability to work with large data sets and run simple formula (VLOOKUP and logic functions are a plus)</li><li>Perform quality assurance and testing to ensure accuracy of setup and ability to process new business</li><li>Retrieve data files from various enrollment platforms and secure server transmissions; validate format and completeness of information received based upon product requirements, and prepare to load into administrative system</li><li>Review state and product compliance requirements, ensure appropriate approvals have been received</li><li>Provide support to field sales, brokers, and employer groups to resolve issues, collect missing information, and ensure accuracy of information received</li><li>Investigate errors that occur on assigned employer groups, research issue and follow through to resolution partnering with internal stakeholders</li><li>Escalate errors and risks as appropriate to bring to resolution and management intervention</li><li>Meet or exceed department established production and quality goals, ensuring service levels are met</li><li>Provide superior customer support to internal and external customers<br><br></li></ul>About Aston Carter:<br><br>Please Note: Scammers are posing as Aston Carter. We'll never contact you via Gmail, Telegram, or WhatsApp and we'll never solicit money from you.<br><br>At Aston Carter, we’re dedicated to expanding career opportunities for the skilled professionals who power our business. Our success is driven by the talented, motivated people who join our team across a range of positions – from recruiting, sales and delivery to corporate roles. As part of our team, employees have the opportunity for long-term career success, where hard work is rewarded and the potential for growth is limitless. Established in 1997, Aston Carter is a leading staffing and consulting firm, providing high-caliber talent and premium services to more than 7,000 companies across North America. Spanning four continents and more than 200 offices, we extend our clients’ capabilities by seeking solvers and delivering solutions to address today’s workforce challenges. For organizations looking for innovative solutions shaped by critical-thinking professionals, visit [AstonCarter.com.](AstonCarter.com) Aston Carter is a company within Allegis Group, a global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call 888-237-6835 or email [astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com](mailto:%20astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com) for other accommodation options. However, if you have questions about this position, please contact the Recruiter located at the bottom of the job posting. The Recruiter is the sole point of contact for questions about this position.

title: Data Engineer
description: <strong>Work with Fortune Global 500 :: New Job Opportunity :: Data Engineer :: Chicago, IL :: Hybrid.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Summary:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The Product Analytics team at Client's End is on a transformational journey to unlock the full potential of enterprise data build a dynamic diverse and inclusive culture and develop a modern cloud-based data lake architecture to scale our applications and drive growth using data and machine learning. </li><li>Our objective is to enable the enterprise to unleash the potential of data through innovation and agile thinking and to execute on an effective data strategy to transform business processes rapidly accelerate time to market and enable insightful decision making. </li></ul> <strong>Job Overview:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>In this role you will partner with various teams to define and execute data acquisition storage transformation processing and make data actionable for operational and analytics initiatives that create sustainable revenue and share growth. </li><li>This role requires expertise in Client's data sources and technology business intuition and a working knowledge of data transformation and analytical tools. </li><li>Manage data integration and technology projects across the various platforms that comprise Client's data strategy</li><li>Assemble large complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. </li><li>Identify design and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes optimizing data delivery re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability etc. </li><li>Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction storage transformation and loading ETL of data from a wide variety of data sources</li><li>Work with stakeholders including the Senior management Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs. </li><li>Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems. </li><li>Build and maintain databases data pipelines and data warehouses that provide a comprehensive understanding of the business. </li><li>Execute unit tests and validating expected results to ensure accuracy integrity of data and applications through analysis coding writing clear documentation and problem resolution. </li><li>Leverage technical and analytical skills to understand and solve business centric questions</li><li>Coordinate and guide cross-functional projects that involve team members across all areas of the enterprise vendors external agencies and partners</li><li> Ability to manage multiple deliverables both short and long-term in a busy and aggressive environment while staying flexible to dynamic needs and priority levels</li><li>Manage agile development and delivery by collaborating with project manager product owner and development leads</li></ul> <strong>Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in quantitative field statistics software engineering business analytics information systems aviation management or related degree</li><li>5 years of experience in data engineering or ETL development role</li><li>Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement. </li><li>Strong analytic skills related to working with structure semi- structure and unstructured datasets. </li><li>Experience with Big Query SQL server etc. </li><li>Experience with AWS cloud services: Redshift S3 Athena etc. </li><li>Experience with SQL and various database interface tools: SSMS Oracle SQL developer etc. </li><li>Passionate about solving problems through data and analytics and creating data products including data models</li><li>Strong initiative to take ownership of data-focused projects get involved in the details of validation and testing as well as provide a business user perspective to their work</li><li>Ability to communicate complex quantitative concepts in a clear precise and actionable manner</li><li>Proven proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills using data to tackle problems</li><li>Outstanding writing communication and presentation skills</li><li>Master's degree</li><li>Experience with Quantum Metrics and Akamai</li><li>Experience with languages: Python R etc. </li><li>Strong experience with continuous integration delivery using Agile methodologies</li><li>Data engineering experience with transportation/airline industry</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Pay Range: $55-65/Hr<p><br></p>The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision as well as 401K contributions.<p><br></p>

manner</li><li>Proven proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills using data to tackle problems</li><li>Outstanding writing communication and presentation skills</li><li>Master's degree</li><li>Experience with Quantum Metrics and Akamai</li><li>Experience with languages: Python R etc. </li><li>Strong experience with continuous integration delivery using Agile methodologies</li><li>Data engineering experience with transportation/airline industry</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Pay Range: $55-65/Hr<p><br></p>The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision as well as 401K contributions.<p><br></p>

title: Data Analyst – Pricing & Margins
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>Plant Name: Oak Brook Executive Office – 105051<br><br>Requisition ID:014280--Corp<br><br><strong><u>Position Summary<br><br></u></strong>This position will develop analytical approaches to provide our sales team with pricing guidance for customer quotes, collect and analyze data to provide insight for site-specific pricing strategies, and develop templates to report on KPIs. This person will work closely with other departments to enhance data integrity and analytical capabilities. In addition, this person will assist with managing and updating the data in the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW).<br><br><strong><u>Essential Duties And Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Develop models to set pricing benchmarks by product type and locations as well as to illustrate price/margin performance and areas for opportunity.</li><li>Partner with IT to maintain and update the product category information at the SKU level in the EDW.</li><li>Work with IT to ensure pricing is implemented correctly in ERP systems.</li><li>Manage, monitor, and respond to daily quote and pricing requests.</li><li>Use Alteryx data management software to update the pricing tools.</li><li>Create templates to report on KPIs as well as the financial and volume impact of pricing actions.</li><li>Assist with calculating unit costs by product type and location for the reconditioning segment for use in identifying low-margin customers.</li><li>Partner with TSMs (Territory Sales Managers) to gain an understanding of each market’s competitive landscape, seasonal trends, raw material sourcing capacity, and plant utilization.</li><li>Provide pricing benchmarks for quote requests submitted by TSMs.</li><li>Assist with ad hoc requests and other duties as assigned.<br></li></ul>We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br><strong><u>Job Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Math, Computer Science, Statistics, Finance or another relevant field.</li><li>Minimum of 2 years’ experience in Pricing, Finance, data analysis, and data manipulation.</li><li>Advanced Microsoft Excel skills required (macros, pivot tables, VBA).</li><li>Microsoft Dynamics SL, QAD, Sage, Salesforce and PowerBI a plus.</li><li>Ability to take ambiguous or incomplete information and turn it into a practical solution.</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; self-starter with the ability to independently identify action items.</li><li>Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and possess the flexibility to quickly adapt to changing needs.</li><li>Possess customer service attitude and continuous improvement mindset.</li><li>Strong team orientation with ability to work collaboratively and influence others across the organization.</li><li>Excellent oral and written communication skills.</li></ul>

title: Director Data Analysis- Marketing
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - United States only (TimeZone: CST | Partial overlap)</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $90 – $110/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements:<br></strong><ul><li>Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience.</li><li>Proficient in Python programming language.</li><li>Strong understanding of APIs and their implementation.</li><li>Experience with Linux scripting and system administration.</li><li>Familiarity with CI/CD methodologies and tools.</li><li>Extensive knowledge of cloud technologies, particularly AWS (e.g., Lambdas, ECS).</li><li>Hands-on experience with Docker and DevOps practices.</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong>Our client is seeking a<strong> Junior Systems Enginee</strong>r to join the team and contribute to the development and enhancement of their developer enablement platform. As a Junior Systems <strong>Engineer, you will be responsible for creating APIs for internal developers, standardizing their CI/CD pipeline, and managing infrastructure.<br><br></strong>If you are an enthusiastic individual who enjoys diving into new technologies and thrives in a dynamic environment, then we encourage you to apply. Join their team and help us build the foundation for their developer enablement platform, making a significant impact on their organization's success.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Collaborate with the development team to create a variety of APIs to support internal developers.</li><li>Contribute to the standardization and improvement of our client's CI/CD pipeline.</li><li>Manage and maintain infrastructure components related to the developer enablement platform.</li><li>Develop back-end solutions using Python and other relevant technologies.</li><li>Utilize Linux scripting for system automation and management.</li><li>Implement cloud technologies, with a strong focus on AWS services such as Lambdas and ECS.</li><li>Ensure smooth integration of various systems and platforms.</li><li>Handle data management and processing tasks.</li><li>Demonstrate a strong willingness to learn and explore new technologies.</li><li>Adapt quickly to changing requirements and work effectively across different platforms and departments.</li><li>Take ownership of assigned tasks and proactively find solutions to challenges.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6628<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description: This is a hybrid position. Will need to be onsite 2 days a week<p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>The Product Analytics team is on a transformational journey to unlock the full potential of enterprise data, build a dynamic, diverse, and inclusive culture and develop a modern cloud-based data lake architecture to scale our applications, and drive growth using data and machine learning. Our objective is to enable the enterprise to unleash the potential of data through innovation and agile thinking, and to execute on an effective data strategy to transform business processes, rapidly accelerate time to market and enable insightful decision making.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Overview And Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>In this role you will partner with various teams to define and execute data acquisition, storage, transformation, processing and make data actionable for operational and analytics initiatives that create sustainable revenue and share growth. This role requires expertise in data sources and technology business intuition, and a working knowledge of data transformation and analytical tools.<p><br></p>" Manage data integration and technology projects across the various platforms that comprise data strategy<p><br></p>" Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.<p><br></p>" Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.<p><br></p>" Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, storage, transformation, and loading (ETL) of data from a wide variety of data sources<p><br></p>" Work with stakeholders including the Senior management, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.<p><br></p>" Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.<p><br></p>" Build and maintain databases, data pipelines, and data warehouses that provide a comprehensive understanding of the business.<p><br></p>" Execute unit tests and validating expected results to ensure accuracy &amp; integrity of data and applications through analysis, coding, writing clear documentation and problem resolution.<p><br></p>" Leverage technical and analytical skills to understand and solve business centric questions<p><br></p>" Coordinate and guide cross-functional projects that involve team members across all areas of the enterprise, vendors, external agencies, and partners<p><br></p>" Ability to manage multiple deliverables both short and long-term in a busy and aggressive environment, while staying flexible to dynamic needs and priority levels<p><br></p>" Manage agile development and delivery by collaborating with project manager, product owner and development leads<p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p>" Bachelor's degree in quantitative field (statistics, software engineering, business analytics, information systems, aviation management or related degree)<p><br></p>" 5+ years of experience in data engineering or ETL development role<p><br></p>" Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.<p><br></p>" Strong analytic skills related to working with structure, semi- structure, and unstructured datasets.<p><br></p>" Experience with Big Query, SQL server, etc.<p><br></p>" Experience with AWS cloud services: Redshift, S3, Athena, etc.<p><br></p>" Experience with SQL and various database interface tools: SSMS, Oracle SQL developer, etc.<p><br></p>" Passionate about solving problems through data and analytics, and creating data products including data models<p><br></p>" Strong initiative to take ownership of data-focused projects, get involved in the details of validation and testing, as well as provide a business user perspective to their work<p><br></p>" Ability to communicate complex quantitative concepts in a clear, precise, and actionable manner<p><br></p>" Proven proficiency with Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint<p><br></p>" Strong problem-solving skills, using data to tackle problems<p><br></p>" Outstanding writing, communication, and presentation skills<p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p>" Master's degree<p><br></p>" Experience with Quantum Metrics and Akamai<p><br></p>" Experience with languages: Python, R, etc.<p><br></p>" Strong experience with continuous integration &amp; delivery using Agile methodologies<p><br></p>" Data engineering experience with transportation/airline industry<p><br></p>" Strong problem-solving skills

Integration testing, customer data quality, testing data verification, regression testing.<p><br></p>The Test Engineer will be responsible for ensuring the successful implementation of new features as well as improvement of existing functionality for data architecture projects. This includes Integration testing, Customer Data Quality testing, Data verification testing, Regression testing etc.<p><br></p>This is a hands-on testing position which requires deep knowledge and understanding of all aspects of developing and executing Back End testing. The Test Engineer must be an advocate for all things Testing and Quality Assurance while driving and implementing best practices. The ideal candidate must possess strong analytical and critical thinking abilities. Data testing skills are required.<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree</li><li>Hands-on experience using SQL queries for results validation and data mining.</li><li>Hands-on experience in Planning and Manual test execution.</li><li>Experience in Regression Test Strategies, Regression suite maintenance and execution.</li><li>At least 3-5 years of professional experience on a variety of projects in Test Strategy, Test Design, Test Execution analysis &amp; reporting.</li><li>Hands-on experience with Jira, ALM, TFS/ADO or similar systems of record.</li><li>Understanding of Development and Test cycles, including respective best practices.</li><li>Hands-on experience in Agile and Waterfall methodologies.</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot issues, identifying root causes and support development team in development of resolutions.</li><li>Strong communication and Client/Business interfacing and interpersonal skills are a must.</li></ul>

title: SQL Database Quality Test Engineer
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - United States only</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $125 – $150/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Short term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong><strong>Skills<br></strong></strong><ul><li>Deep knowledge and hands-on experience with network security, particularly in AWS </li><li>Experience working with SOCII/HIPAA security compliance </li><li>Knowledge of third-party security tools for intrusion detection </li><li>Experience with AWS config, particularly with AWS Linux OS </li><li>Experience with WAF protecting Cloudfront and API Gateway </li><li>Advanced terraform knowledge and experience in a multi-module, multi-environment structure </li><li>Experience with Vanta (desired) or other automated compliance platforms </li><li>CISSP or AWS Security Specialty Certification (desired) </li></ul> <strong><strong>Project goals<br></strong></strong><ul><li>Integrating an Intrusion Detection Tool into our client's AWS environment with proper alarming and notifications </li><li>Improving the network design and policies and introducing NACLs to further protect their systems, e.g. establishing TRUST and UNTRUST rules </li><li>Integrating a few existing EC2 instances into AWS Config with proper baselines and patching </li><li>Enable WAF to defend our client's web/mobile applications in CloudFront and APIs backed by API Gateway and ALB/NLB from attacks including cross-scripting </li><li>Improving security groups and IAM roles to limit exposure </li><li>Configuring advanced security in AWS cognito to defend against compromised credentials </li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong><strong>About The Role<br><br></strong>Our client is looking for a Cloud Security Engineer contractor to help us remediate known security vulnerabilities and implement improvements to their AWS environment to align with their security policies and generally improve the security policies. This project will last 1 to 2 months to prepare for upcoming SOCII/HIPAA compliance audit and could possibly extend further if desired through audit and to help implement more improvements to the policies going forward.<br><br>The company works with PHI data including health insurance claims in the cloud, so security is extremely important to us and their users who trust us to store this sensitive data.<br><br>They operate on AWS using terraform as their IaaC and have generally followed best architecture practices for security but are looking for someone to help accelerate the implementation of their project and guide us with additional expertise of security on what other things they should address to protect their systems from attacks. They have a running product serving thousands of end users and have a fully operational cloud architecture inside a VPC with monitoring and alerting capabilities, so this project would not be starting from scratch and would need to be implemented without impacting service levels.<br><br><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6619<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Short term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong><strong>Skills<br></strong></strong><ul><li>Deep knowledge and hands-on experience with network security, particularly in AWS </li><li>Experience working with SOCII/HIPAA security compliance </li><li>Knowledge of third-party security tools for intrusion detection </li><li>Experience with AWS config, particularly with AWS Linux OS </li><li>Experience with WAF protecting Cloudfront and API Gateway </li><li>Advanced terraform knowledge and experience in a multi-module, multi-environment structure </li><li>Experience with Vanta (desired) or other automated compliance platforms </li><li>CISSP or AWS Security Specialty Certification (desired) </li></ul> <strong><strong>Project goals<br></strong></strong><ul><li>Integrating an Intrusion Detection Tool into our client's AWS environment with proper alarming and notifications </li><li>Improving the network design and policies and introducing NACLs to further protect their systems, e.g. establishing TRUST and UNTRUST rules </li><li>Integrating a few existing EC2 instances into AWS Config with proper baselines and patching </li><li>Enable WAF to defend our client's web/mobile applications in CloudFront and APIs backed by API Gateway and ALB/NLB from attacks including cross-scripting </li><li>Improving security groups and IAM roles to limit exposure </li><li>Configuring advanced security in AWS cognito to defend against compromised credentials </li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong><strong>About The Role<br><br></strong>Our client is looking for a Cloud Security Engineer contractor to help us remediate known security vulnerabilities and implement improvements to their AWS environment to align with their security policies and generally improve the security policies. This project will last 1 to 2 months to prepare for upcoming SOCII/HIPAA compliance audit and could possibly extend further if desired through audit and to help implement more improvements to the policies going forward.<br><br>The company works with PHI data including health insurance claims in the cloud, so security is extremely important to us and their users who trust us to store this sensitive data.<br><br>They operate on AWS using terraform as their IaaC and have generally followed best architecture practices for security but are looking for someone to help accelerate the implementation of their project and guide us with additional expertise of security on what other things they should address to protect their systems from attacks. They have a running product serving thousands of end users and have a fully operational cloud architecture inside a VPC with monitoring and alerting capabilities, so this project would not be starting from scratch and would need to be implemented without impacting service levels.<br><br><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6619<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Cloud Security Engineer [Remote]
description: <p><span>&nbsp;</span><strong>Title:</strong><strong>&nbsp;EDI X12/Oracle SOA B2B/SOA/ODI Developer</strong></p><p><span>Work location:</span><span>&nbsp;Onsite (3 days)-Chicago,IL</span></p><p><br></p><p><span>Type: Contract</span></p><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Job Summary:</u></strong></p><p><span>The EDI X12/Oracle SOA B2B/SOA/ODI Developer will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and maintaining Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions for a variety of clients. The ideal candidate will have expertise in EDI X12/EDIFACT standards and experience working with B2B integrations in Oracle SOA. They will also have experience with Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) and the ability to work with complex data mappings and transformations.</span></p><p><br></p><p><strong><u>Key Responsibilities:</u></strong></p><ul><li><span>Design, develop, test, and maintain Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions</span></li><li><span>Develop EDI X12 mapping and document specifications</span></li><li><span>Create and configure B2B trading partner agreements in Oracle SOA</span></li><li><span>Build and configure SOA composites for data integration</span></li><li><span>Develop complex data mappings and transformations in ODI</span></li><li><span>Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions</span></li><li><span>Collaborate with other developers and stakeholders to ensure the successful delivery of projects</span></li></ul><p><strong><u>Qualifications:</u></strong></p><ul><li><span>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field</span></li><li><span>At least 5-7 years of experience in developing Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions</span></li><li><span>Expertise in EDI X12 standards and B2B integrations in Oracle SOA</span></li><li><span>Experience with Oracle Data Integrator (ODI)</span></li><li><span>Strong understanding of XML, XSD, XSLT, SOAP, REST, and WSDL</span></li><li><span>Proficiency in SQL and PL/SQL</span></li><li><span>Experience with Agile development methodologies</span></li><li><span>Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills</span></li><li><span>Strong communication and collaboration skills</span></li></ul><p><br></p>

title: Oracle Developer
description: NinjaTrader is an investor-backed, growth stage FinTech company servicing hundreds of thousands of traders by providing award-winning software and brokerage services. We are building products and services which empower active traders to easily analyze and react to data from the world's leading financial markets. Located in Chicago, our unique employee-centric company culture is one that our team finds inviting, comfortable and fun. Please visit www.ninjatrader.com to learn more about our business.<br><br><strong>TITLE: </strong>Developer<br><br><strong>DUTIES:</strong> Implement low latency, real time applications which handle large amounts of data; Develop futures trading platform and enterprise web applications using Microsoft .Net, Python, and JavaScript; Develop software and design, implement, test, and maintain a real-time trading application; Take full ownership of projects, including designing, implementing, testing, deploying, maintaining, and iterating; Write and consume scalable web services using .Net and Python for platform independence and service evolution; Develop, deploy and maintain in-house applications for accounting, compliance, and support teams; Write efficient SQL queries and procedures for backend and data operations.<br><br><strong>MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: </strong>Bachelor's degree in Computer Engineering or related field of study and 1 year of experience in the job offered or related. Academic knowledge of or experience must include: System security; Computer Networking and Advanced Computer Networking; Database and advanced database management systems; Analysis of algorithm and design; Distributed computing.<br><br><strong>OTHER:</strong> Employer: NinjaTrader Clearing, LLC. Job Site: 21805 W Field Parkway, Suite 360, Deer Park, IL 60010; 40 hours/week. If offered employment must have legal right to work in U.S.<br><br><strong>Our Benefits: <br></strong><ul><li>Health, Vision, Dental Coverage </li><li>401k with Company Match </li><li>Life and Disability Insurance covered 100% by NinjaTrader </li><li>Generous PTO </li><li>7 paid holidays annually <br><br></li></ul><em>We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, or veteran status. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.</em>

title: Developer
description: Job Category: Engineering<p><br></p>Time Type: Full time<p><br></p>Minimum Clearance Required to Start: TS/SCI with Polygraph<p><br></p>Employee Type: Regular<p><br></p>Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10%<p><br></p>Type of Travel: Local<p><br></p><strong><u>Primary Purpose</u></strong><p><br></p>Under limited direction develop requirements, plans, presentations, and track, verify associated results on a Research &amp; Development team with impact to finances, security, software and hardware. Planning and execution for program’s financial oversight, security interactions, quality system, process development and improvement, and overall program customer satisfaction.<p><br></p><strong><u>Duties And Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop program requirements and plans for supporting customer funded tasks within budget and on scheduled with managed risk</li><li>Analyze, design and implement customer presentations illustrating program progress toward financial, security, staffing and technical goals</li><li>Aide in planning of and oversight for equipment and material acquisition in support of program activities</li><li>Aide in planning of and oversight for computer and networking systems in support of program activities</li><li>Operate effectively and comfortably in a team environment, as a team member of a larger team and as a team leader</li><li>Promote open communication among your team and across team boundaries</li><li>Understand and adhere to all CACI Ethical and Compliance policies</li><li>Proactively ensure a safe work environment and adhere to CACI EH&amp;S policies and procedures</li><li>Travel to other CACI Locations or Customer Sites as necessary</li><li>Perform other duties as required</li><li>Obtain/retain a government security clearance at the level required to perform the duties of the position</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills And Knowledge</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrated ability to provide concise analysis of complex systems to provide clear requirements and guidance to achieve project goals</li><li>Ability to understand wider objectives and status of the program spanning multiple disciplines to construct easily understandable presentations to a customer</li><li>Excellent oral and written communication skills including demonstrated ability to clearly convey information to a customer</li><li>Expert knowledge of Microsoft software applications (e.g., Excel) and other software applications as required</li><li>Knowledge of telephony, signaling, networking equipment, computer center operations is desirable</li><li>Knowledge of government contracting is desirable</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Education And Experience</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, or Computer Engineering and minimum of 6 years of related experience or an equivalent combination of education, skills, and experience</li><li>Master’s degree preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Working Conditions</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Work is typically performed in an office environment which requires proper safety precautions. Work may require some physical effort in the handling of light materials, boxes, or equipment.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We Can Offer You</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.</li><li> Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.</li><li> We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.</li><li> We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities.</li><li> For over 60 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success.</li></ul><p><br></p>Company Overview: At CACI, you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers. CACI is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.

title: Desktop Support Analyst
description: Description <br><br>In this role, you will be responsible for ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of our mobile devices and data through the implementation of secure global MDM solution (VMWare Workspace ONE). You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify potential security risks and develop security solutions to protect our mobile devices and data from unauthorized access, malware, and cyber-attacks. Additional areas of responsibility:<br><ul><li> Implement secure global MDM program utilizing VMWare Workspace One and Lookout for device security</li><li> Design and implement secure MDM policies and procedures to protect our mobile devices and data from unauthorized access, malware, and cyber-attacks</li><li> Conducting security assessments, creating security reports, and implementing security controls to safeguard our organization's data</li><li> Ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of our mobile devices and data</li><li> Develop and maintain operational documentation related to MDM security policies and procedures</li><li> Stay up to date with the latest security trends, threats, and vulnerabilities Key Qualifications, Experience and Knowledge</li><li> Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field</li><li> 5+ years of experience in information security or related field</li><li> Experience with MDM and mobile security technologies</li><li> Understanding of security risk management frameworks, such as NIST, ISO, or COBIT</li><li> Demonstrated knowledge of security policies and procedures for MDM</li><li> Excellent communication and collaboration skills for cross-functional teams</li><li> Security certifications (CISSP, CISM, CRISC, or other security certifications) are a plus If you have a passion for ensuring security and thrive in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply for this role. General Skills, Personal Attributes and Certifications</li><li> Strong communication skills with diverse audiences and demonstrated ability to explain technical topics to those without a technical background</li><li> Strong leadership, project, and team-building skills, including the ability to lead teams and drive projects and initiatives in multiple organizations<br><br></li></ul> Skills <br><br>WorkspaceOne, Lookout, mobile device management, Security, Information security<br><br> Top Skills Details <br><br>WorkspaceOne,Lookout,mobile device management,Security,Information security<br><br> Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications <br><br>Ability to work with others in a fast paced environment<br><br> Experience Level <br><br>Intermediate Level<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: MDM Security Engineer
description: At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>U.S. Bank is seeking a Quality Assurance Analyst with demonstrated project management and process improvement experience to contribute toward the success of our technology initiatives. Participates in the quality assurance process following procedures to ensure that all information systems products and services meet company standards and end-user requirements. Recognizes and identifies areas where quality assurance policies and procedures need to be changed or developed and documents those standards. Conducts project reviews and complex process audits and assists in major audits/reviews of projects and subcontractors. Ensures deliverables meet audit criteria. Interfaces with clients to ensure that systems are developed which meet their business need and specifications. Evaluates and reviews products and processes. Provides status reporting to Quality Assurance and site management and involves senior management, as needed, to resolve deficiencies or compliance issues in a timely manner. Communicates and endorses strict adherence to methodologies, processes, and standards and monitors adherence on an on-going basis. Works on problem resolutions and reports progress to management. Maintains contact with customers, when required, to ensure project quality expectations are understood and met. Reviews status of quality assurance initiatives and collaborates with other IT managers to ensure quality objectives are being attained. Oversees multiple quality assurance projects which include development, installation, and maintenance. Assists in planning and estimation of Quality Assurance support for new programs and projects. Develops, publishes, and implements test plans to ensure quality applications and writes, maintains, and automates software testing. Senior level QA Analysts may manage a small staff of employees and schedule and prioritize work and activities to meet target schedule, quality, scope, and cost objectives, as well as direct, motivate, and develop staff as a team.<br><br><strong>Basic Qualifications<br><br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience</li><li> At least two years of experience with the processes, tools, techniques and practices for assuring adherence to quality standards associated with developing, enhancing and operationalizing application systems and databases<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Skills/Experience<br><br></strong>ITIL Service Management Foundation certification<br><br>Basic understanding in:<br><br><ul><li>IT service level agreements</li><li>System testing tools</li><li>Software process improvement<br><br></li></ul>Working experience in:<br><br><ul><li>Requirements analysis</li><li>Application testing</li><li>System testing</li><li>Software quality assurance</li><li>IT quality assurance<br><br></li></ul>If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.<br><br><strong>Learn how</strong> the way we work at U.S. Bank drives meaningful relationships with our customers and collaboration across the company.<br><br><strong>Benefits:<br><br></strong>Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Our benefits include the following (some may vary based on role, location or hours):<br><br><ul><li>Healthcare (medical, dental, vision)</li><li>Basic term and optional term life insurance</li><li>Short-term and long-term disability</li><li>Pregnancy disability and parental leave</li><li>401(k) and employer-funded retirement plan</li><li>Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure)</li><li>Up to 11 paid holiday opportunities</li><li>Adoption assistance</li><li>Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law<br><br></li></ul><strong>EEO is the Law<br><br></strong>U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. The actual range for the role may differ based on the location of the role. In addition to salary, US Bank offers a comprehensive benefits package, including incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase 401k contribution and pension (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). Pay Range: $81,515.00 - $95,900.00 - $105,490.00
description_json: At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>U.S. Bank is seeking a Quality Assurance Analyst with demonstrated project management and process improvement experience to contribute toward the success of our technology initiatives. Participates in the quality assurance process following procedures to ensure that all information systems products and services meet company standards and end-user requirements. Recognizes and identifies areas where quality assurance policies and procedures need to be changed or developed and documents those standards. Conducts project reviews and complex process audits and assists in major audits/reviews of projects and subcontractors. Ensures deliverables meet audit criteria. Interfaces with clients to ensure that systems are developed which meet their business need and specifications. Evaluates and reviews products and processes. Provides status reporting to Quality Assurance and site management and involves senior management, as needed, to resolve deficiencies or compliance issues in a timely manner. Communicates and endorses strict adherence to methodologies, processes, and standards and monitors adherence on an on-going basis. Works on problem resolutions and reports progress to management. Maintains contact with customers, when required, to ensure project quality expectations are understood and met. Reviews status of quality assurance initiatives and collaborates with other IT managers to ensure quality objectives are being attained. Oversees multiple quality assurance projects which include development, installation, and maintenance. Assists in planning and estimation of Quality Assurance support for new programs and projects. Develops, publishes, and implements test plans to ensure quality applications and writes, maintains, and automates software testing. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. title: Microsoft Power Platform Developer
description: <strong>TITLE: Associate QC Analyst </strong><p><br></p><strong>LOCATION: Argo</strong><p><br></p><strong>REPORTS TO: QC Lead</strong><p><br></p>The <strong>Associate QC Analyst </strong>supports the Hydrate Dextrose and Anhydrous Laboratories by performing analytical tests independently and accurately. Meet the needs of internal and external customers in a safe and timely manner on process and product quality.<p><br></p><strong><u>Core Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Perform methods from the United States Pharmacopeia (USP), American Chemical Society (ACS), Food Chemical Codex (FCC) and other validated procedures independently. </li><li>Perform a variety of tasks/procedures in a fast-paced environment; maintain accurate and complete record of data. </li><li>Prioritize testing based on business needs and ensure testing is performed in an appropriate and timely manner. </li><li>Collect samples of finished products.</li><li>Maintain complete, accurate and legible test records, in accordance with Company policy and record keeping procedure. </li><li>Follow all safety guidelines and quality systems established by Ingredion. </li><li>Develop a working knowledge of product and customers specifications. Disposition product against established specifications. </li><li>Perform other work as assigned by laboratory management.</li><li>Revise and update methods independently. </li><li>Assist in maintenance of equipment, including routine maintenance and resolution of common or simple problems with instruments.</li><li>Communicate technical data to technical and non-technical people, both verbal and written.</li><li>Learn new skills and assist in the training of others.</li><li>Demonstrate organizational skills, prioritize multiple tasks, written, verbal and computer skills</li><li>LSS experience is desired.</li><li>Ability to work in a diverse team environment.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualified Candidate Will Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in Chemistry, Food Science, or related sciences.</li><li>Possess knowledge of laboratory practices</li><li>Cover shifts as needed. Must be available for weekend and after hour coverage.</li><li>Self-starter with a strong work ethic.</li><li>High level of integrity and sincerity.</li><li>Proactive and innovative with a strong will to succeed.</li><li>Ability to communicate at all levels.</li><li>Sound overall knowledge of regulatory rules, policies, procedures in the areas of GMP, Quality, Environmental Management and Health &amp; Safety.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Ingredion provides accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process. If a job applicant requires an accommodation during the application process or through the selection process, we will work with the applicant to meet the job applicant's accommodation needs.</strong><p><br></p>We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, military status, or disability status.<p><br></p><u><strong>Relocation Available:</strong></u><p><br></p>No

title: QA Engineer
description: Location: Chicago (Hybrid)<br><br><strong><u>Job Description<br></u></strong><ul><li> The Hybrid Cloud Services Engineer will be held accountable for the following responsibilities:</li><li> Assist in the design, build, management and operation of the infrastructure as a service layer (hosted and cloud-based platforms) that supports the different platform services.</li><li> Implementation of various cloud services according to business demand</li><li> Ensuring and defining compliance and security rules for a safe cloud infrastructure</li><li> Interconnect modern cloud services with on premise resources.</li><li> Coordinate and configure IT infrastructure services needed to provide comprehensive platform services for web applications to the business.</li><li> Design templates to assure standardized cloud infrastructure.</li><li> Interact with colleagues from other IT areas to resolve cross functional and project issues.</li><li> Incident – and problem management and request fulfillment as part of second/third level support.</li><li> Proactively identify where system or process improvements can increase efficiency and customer satisfaction.</li><li> Act as technical provider manager in a mixed mode operational environment</li><li> Work with team members to receive cross-training on individual roles and responsibilities.</li><li> Manage day-to-day print server provisioning, using standard tools.</li><li> Respond to and resolve alerts generated by print server monitoring tool.</li><li> Work with application teams to resolve issues as relates to print server software installation on servers managed by the Infrastructure Server Team.</li><li> Consults with third party vendors to obtain support, make recommendations, and assist customers with their requests.</li><li> Perform the initial input of print server-related assets into the server asset database.</li><li> Participate in Windows server "On-Call” rotation, which provides for an engineer to be available to deal with server emergencies on a 24x7 basis.<br></li></ul>In order to be successful and achieve the above responsibilities, the Windows Server Engineer must<br><br><strong><u>Possess The Following Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Type of Education Preferred:<br><br>bachelor's degree or equivalent.<br><br><strong><u>The Following Certifications Are a Plus But Not Required<br></u></strong><ul><li>Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert</li><li>Red hat Certified Specialist in OpenShift Administration</li><li>AWS SySOps Administrator<br></li></ul><strong><u>Type Of Experience And Number Of Years<br></u></strong><ul><li> Hands on experience in API Management, Azure Data Factory (ADF)</li><li> Strong cross functional knowledge (network, database, webservices, AI, Infrastructure)</li><li> Eager to learn and stay up to date on the fast-evolving cloud environment<br></li></ul>Database skills are a plus.<br><ul><li> Programming/scripting skills are a plus (PowerShell, python, terraforms, C#)</li><li> Comprehensive understanding of cloud delivery models: PaaS, SaaS, and IaaS.</li><li> Exposure to OpenShift Container Platform (OCP), and well versed in Kubernetes, microservices architecture and cloud architecture.</li><li> Familiarity with continuous integration/deployment processes and tools such as IDEs (Eclipse), Source Code management. (GIT/Stash), Jenkins, Maven, Nexus artifacts, etc.</li><li> 5 years or more experience of Windows Server 2008 through 2022 in a Hyper-V / System Center.</li><li> Virtual Machine Manager within an Enterprise Datacenter/Cloud Hybrid environment</li><li> Experience with Microsoft Failover Clustering, Host/OS Patching, Migrations, and Azure<br></li></ul>administration.<br><br><strong><u>Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Must have good interpersonal, leadership, collaboration, facilitation, and negotiation skills and be able to manage conflict.</li><li> Must have excellent communication skills and be able to explain complex technical issues in a way that non-technical people can understand as well as be able to explain customer needs and priorities in a way that technical people can understand.</li></ul>

title: Associate Quality Control Analyst
description: A client in the Greater Chicago area is seeking a Systems/Networking Engineer to join their team. In this role you will manage and maintain Windows servers, ensuring optimal performance, security, and availability. You will configure, monitor, and troubleshoot network infrastructure, and you will provide technical support and assistance to end-users, resolving issues related to systems, networks, and connectivity. This is a full time, direct hire role.<br><br><strong>Location:</strong> Hybrid in the Great Chicago area (on site 3x/wk)<br><br><strong>Salary: </strong>Up to 120K DOE<br><br><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Proven experience as a Systems/Networking Engineer in a Windows environment </li><li>Strong knowledge of Windows servers, VMware, and Active Directory administration </li><li>Familiarity with network protocols, routing, and switching. </li><li>Experience in configuring and troubleshooting VPNs and firewalls </li><li>Solid understanding of network security principles and best practices <br></li></ul><strong><u>Pluses<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field </li><li>CCNA/CCNP certification\<br></li></ul>indsepchi2hi

description: <p>We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries who are thinking about their next move or looking for a new opportunity to join our expanding talent pool.<br><br><br></p><p><strong>The F4S Talent Pool is a pilot project designed to:<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>Help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs.</li><li>Provide optional support and resources for job seekers in their career endeavors.</li><li>Help individuals understand, and bring out the best in themselves and each other.</li></ul><p><br><br></p><p><strong>The F4S Talent Pool process:<br><br></strong></p><p>Once you express your interest, you will be asked to complete the F4S work style assessment which measures 48 key attitudes and motivations in the context of work. On completion, you will be automatically added to our growing talent pool and contacted as new opportunities arise.<br><br></p><p><br><br></p><p><strong>About Fingerprint For Success (F4S)<br><br></strong></p><p>Backed by 20+ years of research, F4S’s revolutionary predictive analytics have achieved over 90% reliability in forecasting personal and team motivations, behaviors, and performance. Ultimately, we help people find purpose and fulfillment at work, and help build and scale high performing teams.<br><br><br></p><p>Keep in mind, joining our talent pool does not guarantee a job offer. We aim to balance your technical skills with the results of your F4S work style assessment to match the hiring needs of our partners.<br><br></p><p><br>Your feedback is a gift! Write to us via: hello@f4s.com to help co-create the future of recruitment, together.<br><br></p>

title: Cloud Engineer
description: Description <br><br>Design, implement and operate security controls for various services in the Microsoft and Amazon cloud, with a primary focus in Azure AD. -Design and implement access control policies within Azure AD and MDM. -Analyze requirements and apply knowledge of business needs and security risks to determine appropriate course of action. -Collaborate with different areas of IT in order to provide security and business technology solutions for the Bank. -Development of security policy, standard, procedure and design documents. -Design, engineer, and deploy technologies for application integrations for using SAML, Open ID, or OAuth -Act as a point of escalation for issues relating to security controls or tools, including (but not limited to) SSO, MFA, certificates. -Design, implement and operate security controls for various services in Office 365, with an emphasis on Azure AD identity -Understanding of OAuth and assist with the interface with Azure API’s -Occasionally provide support off-hours when business critical problems arise. Software Requirements - Active Directory (On-Prem) - Azure Active Directory -Azure AD Conditional Access -Windows Servers (2016 and newer) -Azure AD Seamless SSO Preferred: - CyberArk (Preferred) - Azure B2C (preferred) - Azure Application Proxy (preferred) Additional Responsibilities: o Scripting/automation experience such as Python, PowerShell and API integrations o Contribute to design and execute delivery for technologies that improve overall security posture or technology service delivery within the organization. o Analyze requirements and apply knowledge of business needs and security risks to determine appropriate course of action. o Develop security standards and procedures to ensure appropriate controls throughout the technology environment. o Collaborate with different areas of IT in order to provide security and business technology solutions for the bank.<br><br> Skills <br><br>Azure AD, Authorization, Conditional Access, SSO<br><br> Top Skills Details <br><br>Azure AD,Authorization,Conditional Access,SSO<br><br> Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications <br><br>Ability to work with a team Able to go onsite two days a week<br><br> Experience Level <br><br>Expert Level<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

Software Requirements - Active Directory (On-Prem) - Azure Active Directory -Azure AD Conditional Access -Windows Servers (2016 and newer) -Azure AD Seamless SSO Preferred: - CyberArk (Preferred) - Azure B2C (preferred) - Azure Application Proxy (preferred) Additional Responsibilities: o Scripting/automation experience such as Python, PowerShell and API integrations o Contribute to design and execute delivery for technologies that improve overall security posture or technology service delivery within the organization. o Analyze requirements and apply knowledge of business needs and security risks to determine appropriate course of action. o Develop security standards and procedures to ensure appropriate controls throughout the technology environment. o Collaborate with different areas of IT in order to provide security and business technology solutions for the bank.<br><br> Skills <br><br>Azure AD, Authorization, Conditional Access, SSO<br><br> Top Skills Details <br><br>Azure AD,Authorization,Conditional Access,SSO<br><br> Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications <br><br>Ability to work with a team Able to go onsite two days a week<br><br> Experience Level <br><br>Expert Level<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Systems/Networking Engineer
description: <strong><strong>Every great story has a new beginning, and yours starts here.</strong></strong><p><br></p><strong><strong>Welcome to Warner Bros. Discovery… the stuff dreams are made of.</strong></strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Who We Are…</u></strong><p><br></p>When we say, “the stuff dreams are made of,” we’re not just referring to the world of wizards, dragons and superheroes, or even to the wonders of Planet Earth. Behind WBD’s vast portfolio of iconic content and beloved brands, are the <strong>storytellers</strong> bringing our characters to life, the <strong>creators</strong> bringing them to your living rooms and the <strong>dreamers</strong> creating what’s next…<p><br></p>From brilliant creatives, to technology trailblazers, across the globe, WBD offers career defining opportunities, thoughtfully curated benefits, and the tools to explore and grow into your best selves. Here you are supported, here you are celebrated, here you can thrive.<p><br></p>The creative team that brought Mortal Kombat and Injustice to life is now NetherRealm Studios, part of the Warner Bros. Games family. With over 20 years of creation under our belts, NetherRealm’s mission remains the same: to create cutting edge entertainment and deliver industry leading tech, game art and overall gaming experiences. NetherRealm Studios is a collaborative and creative environment, constantly striving to up the ante on what is possible in interactive entertainment. Our team is comprised of dedicated professionals with years of experience who are at the forefront of the gaming industry. The passion and energy that made Mortal Kombat a reality is still on display every day in our offices, our hallways and most definitely the studio’s arcade room.<p><br></p><strong>Your New Role...</strong><p><br></p>Netherrealm Studios, a division of WB Games Inc., seeks a Gameplay Software Engineer, to work with the game development team responsible for Mortal Kombat and Injustice 2 to help make NetherRealm's next project it’s most successful to date.<p><br></p>As a member of the game play team, you will work closely with the lead game programmer, and the game play programming team to implement new features, and support the design team in their efforts to create a compelling game experience. The position offers many opportunities to share experience, knowledge, and expertise across the team and code base.<p><br></p>As a Gameplay Engineer, your domain will span as much of the codebase as your skills and interests dictate, as you design and implement extensions to existing systems and pivotal new game systems to meet the needs of our talented in-house team of content developers.<p><br></p><strong><u>Your Role Accountabilities...</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, author, maintain and refactor game systems that meet all design, technical and schedule requirements</li><li>Work closely with QA and your technical leadership to ensure the stability and accuracy of game systems by identifying, communicating and resolving defects</li><li>Author, review and provide feedback on technical and end-user documentation of game systems</li><li>Collaborate with technical leadership and other engineers to help establish overall technical design and architecture</li><li>Work closely with the production staff in building and maintaining realistic schedules and identifying dependencies</li><li>Coordinate with QA and leads to ensure successful roll out of new features to the team and establish testing and maintenance of systems</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications &amp; Experience...</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>3+ years professional C/C++ programming.</li><li>Experience working in a large code base.</li><li>A passion for software and problem solving</li><li>Experience developing games (Xbox One or PS4 is a plus)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>How We Get Things Done…</u></strong><p><br></p>This last bit is probably the most important! Here at WBD, our guiding principles are the core values by which we operate and are central to how we get things done. You can find them at www.wbd.com/guiding-principles/ along with some insights from the team on what they mean and how they show up in their day to day. We hope they resonate with you and look forward to discussing them during your interview.<p><br></p><strong>The Legal Bits…</strong><p><br></p>Warner Bros. Discovery embraces the opportunity to build a workforce that reflects the diversity of our society and the world around us. Being an equal opportunity employer means that we take seriously our responsibility to consider qualified candidates on the basis of merit, without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.<p><br></p>If you’re a qualified candidate with a disability and you need a reasonable accommodation in order to apply for this position, please contact us at recruitadmin@wbd.com.

title: Expression of Interest: Mobile Application Developer
description: <p>We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries who are thinking about their next move or looking for a new opportunity to join our expanding talent pool.<br><br><br></p><p><strong>The F4S Talent Pool is a pilot project designed to:<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>Help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs.</li><li>Provide optional support and resources for job seekers in their career endeavors.</li><li>Help individuals understand, and bring out the best in themselves and each other.</li></ul><p><br><br></p><p><strong>The F4S Talent Pool process:<br><br></strong></p><p>Once you express your interest, you will be asked to complete the F4S work style assessment which measures 48 key attitudes and motivations in the context of work. On completion, you will be automatically added to our growing talent pool and contacted as new opportunities arise.<br><br></p><p><br><br></p><p><strong>About Fingerprint For Success (F4S)<br><br></strong></p><p>Backed by 20+ years of research, F4S’s revolutionary predictive analytics have achieved over 90% reliability in forecasting personal and team motivations, behaviors, and performance. Ultimately, we help people find purpose and fulfillment at work, and help build and scale high performing teams.<br><br><br></p><p>Keep in mind, joining our talent pool does not guarantee a job offer. We aim to balance your technical skills with the results of your F4S work style assessment to match the hiring needs of our partners.<br><br></p><p><br>Your feedback is a gift! Write to us via: hello@f4s.com to help co-create the future of recruitment, together.<br><br></p>
