title: Enterprise Monitoring Engineer
description: <p><strong>Description</strong></p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><br></p><p><span>We have a fairly urgent need for an Android (Kotlin) experienced developer.&nbsp;They have to have a minimum of 5 years experience in Android development&nbsp;Our first location preference will be Chicago and the second preference will be Houston and the 3rd preference will be visiting either Chicago/Houston office on his cost.</span></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications - External</strong></p><ul><li><strong>Required</strong><span>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Information Technology, related field or related experience</span></li><li><span>5+ years of professional development experience and knowledge in Android (Kotlin&nbsp;preferred)</span></li><li>5+ years of experience in design patterns and enterprise standards in application design</li><li><span>Exceptional at coding and on time delivery of quality components and or applications</span></li><li><span>Exceptional at component and unit testing of following standard practices and methodologies</span></li><li><span>Exceptional utilizing the technologies and domain knowledge with the delivery of developed components or integrated components</span></li><li>Exceptional at working problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires review of a variety of factors</li><li><span>Ability to work in Central Time Zone (CST) or Eastern Time Zone (EST)</span></li><li><strong>Preferred</strong><span>5+ years of experience and knowledge in iOS development (Swift/SwiftUI/UIKit).</span></li><li><span>Familiarity of full stack development</span></li><li><span>Familiarity of networking concepts and</span></li><li><span>Familiarity with code repositories like TFS,&nbsp;GitHub</span></li><li>Experience in the Airline Industry is a PLUS</li></ul><p><br></p>

title: Software Engineer
description: Principal, Quantitative Risk Management<p><br></p>SALARY: $250K PLUS 25%<p><br></p>LOCATION: CHICAGO<p><br></p>Hybrid 3 days onsite, 2 days remote open to H1b transfer<p><br></p>Looking for a candidate with 7 years C# .Net, AWS ND Quant Financial models experience<p><br></p>C# technical coding skills at a hands on, Architect and occasionally, manager level (no direct reports)<p><br></p>Develop Custom Applications Servers.<p><br></p><ul><li>This is an IT person with Finserve skills</li><li>Still discussing but will have to create once decided as to practical usage.</li></ul><p><br></p>Reporting to Model Validation, this person will link Model group with Renaissance Risk over the next 18 months~<p><br></p>Must haves in this order<p><br></p>C#, AWS, Quant (Financial models)<p><br></p>Then there will be RenRisk testing/validation<p><br></p>Work to develop proper and useful Information Secure Zones.<p><br></p>There will be some Front End work so Javascript is important to have<p><br></p>Must be able to separate critical from dependable from practical, solutions on a daily basis /<p><br></p>You will provide support for the review and signoff of the Renaissance Risk Pillar test plans and test results.<p><br></p><strong><u>Technical Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>7+ years .NET and C# development experience</li><li>5+ years of JavaScript experience, including React and typescript.</li><li>2+ years working in Cloud environment.</li><li>2+ years Java development, 3+ years developing quantitative financial models.</li><li>Experience as architect for both Front End and Back End solutions. </li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs</li><li>Experience following Git workflows</li><li>Working knowledge of DevOps tools. Eg Terraform, Ansible, Jenkins, Kubernetes, Helm and CI/CD pipeline etc.</li><li>Experience with financial data.</li><li>BS degree in Computer Science, or similar technical field required. Masters preferred.</li></ul>

title: Expression of Interest: Machine Learning Engineer
description: <p><span>Founded in 1898 and headquartered in Chicago, IL, GATX Corporation (NYSE:GATX) strives to be recognized as the finest railcar leasing company worldwide. Our competitive advantage is our full-service leasing business model, including a world-class railcar maintenance network. The key to our long-term growth and success is attracting and retaining top talent. <br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>The Reliability Engineer will support GATX's engineering data analytics and reliability analysis efforts. The incumbent will leverage data analysis to influence railroads, government and industry rule-making authorities toward decisions in the business interest of GATX. This position is expected to significantly impact Safety, Quality, Delivery and Costs objectives with these efforts.<br><br></span></p><p> <br><br></p><p><span><span>Optimize the reliability of life-cycle maintenance on the GATX rail fleet.<br><br></span></span></p><ul><li><span>Analyze and track all key fleet performance indicators to drive strategic improvement to GATX SQDC (Safety, Quality, Delivery and Cost).</span></li><li><span>Utilize Weibull++ and other reliability software to manage GATX reliability program.</span></li><li><span>Optimize the schedule and standard work for planned maintenance events.</span></li><li><span>Prevent unplanned maintenance events.</span></li><li><span>Support implementation of reliability benefits in GATX instructions, specifications, reporting, computer systems, policies, and process.</span></li></ul><p><span>Support GATX Ops strategic initiatives with data analysis and implementation.<br><br></span></p><ul><li><span>Develop and maintain reliability reports and dashboards using PowerBI.</span></li><li><span>Measure the effectiveness of engineering programs for impact on SQDC.</span></li><li><span>Eliminate systemic defects to maintenance quality with Quality Assurance.</span></li><li><span>Support Best Practice teams on measurable impact to SQDC.</span></li></ul><p><span>Support GATX Commercial with fleet performance data analysis.<br><br></span></p><ul><li><span>Analyze maintenance cost trends.</span></li><li><span>Provide analyses to customers in order to support qualification intervals, provide comparative analyses on components, etc.</span></li></ul><p><span><span>Influence government and industry rule-making authorities toward the best interest of GATX, and support regulatory requests.<br><br></span></span></p><ul><li><span>Influence regulatory outcomes with reliable data metrics, industry committee participation, and task group leadership.</span></li><li><span>Support Service Reliability Assessments requests from FRA</span></li><li><span>Provide authorities with impact forecasts of proposed rule changes.</span></li><li><span>Validate effectiveness of GATX tank car qualification and remediation programs with FRA officials.</span></li></ul><p> <br><br></p><p><span><strong><span>Education and/or Experience Required (including certifications)</span></strong><span>:<br><br></span></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><ul><li><span>B.S. in Engineering or other technical discipline</span></li><li><span>Advanced level skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerBI</span></li><li><span>Familiarity with statistics and formal methods of data analysis</span></li><li><span>Certification in reliability engineering data analysis and modeling is a plus</span></li><li><span>Experience with Rail car design and repair is a plus</span></li><li><span>Familiarity with Rail car rules and regulations is a plus</span></li></ul><p><span>For internal candidates only:<br><br></span></p><ul><li><span>Knowledge of GATX engineering policy, programs, specifications, and work instructions is a plus</span></li><li><span>Knowledge of GATX data sources and analytical tools is a plus</span></li></ul><p><span><strong><span>Other (i.e., physical requirements, travel, etc. that is not covered above):  </span></strong><span>This position is based in the Chicago Corporate office and considered hybrid with 60% in office attendance required. Minimal travel to maintenance facilities and industry committee meetings will be required, and employee must be physically able to climb on, inside, or under rail cars.<br><br></span></span></p><p><span><strong><span> <br><br></span></strong></span></p><p><span><strong>GATX embraces diversity, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.<br><br></strong></span></p><p> <br><br></p><p><span><strong>We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.<br><br></strong></span></p>
description_json: <p><span>Founded in 1898 and headquartered in Chicago, IL, GATX Corporation (NYSE:GATX) strives to be recognized as the finest railcar leasing company worldwide. Our competitive advantage is our full-service leasing business model, including a world-class railcar maintenance network. The key to our long-term growth and success is attracting and retaining top talent. <br><br></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><p><span>The Reliability Engineer will support GATX's engineering data analytics and reliability analysis efforts. The incumbent will leverage data analysis to influence railroads, government and industry rule-making authorities toward decisions in the business interest of GATX. This position is expected to significantly impact Safety, Quality, Delivery and Costs objectives with these efforts.<br><br></span></p><p> <br><br></p><p><span><span>Optimize the reliability of life-cycle maintenance on the GATX rail fleet.<br><br></span></span></p><ul><li><span>Analyze and track all key fleet performance indicators to drive strategic improvement to GATX SQDC (Safety, Quality, Delivery and Cost).</span></li><li><span>Utilize Weibull++ and other reliability software to manage GATX reliability program.</span></li><li><span>Optimize the schedule and standard work for planned maintenance events.</span></li><li><span>Prevent unplanned maintenance events.</span></li><li><span>Support implementation of reliability benefits in GATX instructions, specifications, reporting, computer systems, policies, and process.</span></li></ul><p><span>Support GATX Ops strategic initiatives with data analysis and implementation.<br><br></span></p><ul><li><span>Develop and maintain reliability reports and dashboards using PowerBI.</span></li><li><span>Measure the effectiveness of engineering programs for impact on SQDC.</span></li><li><span>Eliminate systemic defects to maintenance quality with Quality Assurance.</span></li><li><span>Support Best Practice teams on measurable impact to SQDC.</span></li></ul><p><span>Support GATX Commercial with fleet performance data analysis.<br><br></span></p><ul><li><span>Analyze maintenance cost trends.</span></li><li><span>Provide analyses to customers in order to support qualification intervals, provide comparative analyses on components, etc.</span></li></ul><p><span><span>Influence government and industry rule-making authorities toward the best interest of GATX, and support regulatory requests.<br><br></span></span></p><ul><li><span>Influence regulatory outcomes with reliable data metrics, industry committee participation, and task group leadership.</span></li><li><span>Support Service Reliability Assessments requests from FRA</span></li><li><span>Provide authorities with impact forecasts of proposed rule changes.</span></li><li><span>Validate effectiveness of GATX tank car qualification and remediation programs with FRA officials.</span></li></ul><p> <br><br></p><p><span><strong><span>Education and/or Experience Required (including certifications)</span></strong><span>:<br><br></span></span></p><p><span> <br><br></span></p><ul><li><span>B.S. in Engineering or other technical discipline</span></li><li><span>Advanced level skills in Microsoft Excel and PowerBI</span></li><li><span>Familiarity with statistics and formal methods of data analysis</span></li><li><span>Certification in reliability engineering data analysis and modeling is a plus</span></li><li><span>Experience with Rail car design and repair is a plus</span></li><li><span>Familiarity with Rail car rules and regulations is a plus</span></li></ul><p><span>For internal candidates only:<br><br></span></p><ul><li><span>Knowledge of GATX engineering policy, programs, specifications, and work instructions is a plus</span></li><li><span>Knowledge of GATX data sources and analytical tools is a plus</span></li></ul><p><span><strong><span>Other (i.e., physical requirements, travel, etc. that is not covered above):  </span></strong><span>This position is based in the Chicago Corporate office and considered hybrid with 60% in office attendance required. Minimal travel to maintenance facilities and industry committee meetings will be required, and employee must be physically able to climb on, inside, or under rail cars.<br><br></span></span></p><p><span><strong><span> <br><br></span></strong></span></p><p><span><strong>GATX embraces diversity, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.<br><br></strong></span></p><p> <br><br></p><p><span><strong>We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.<br><br></strong></span></p>

title: Expression of Interest: Mobile Application Developer
description: *We are unable to sponsor for this permanent Full time role*<p><br></p>*Position is bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Global Firm is currently seeking an Identity and Access Management Engineer with SailPoint experience. Candidate will be integrating internal applications with SailPoint using OAuth methodologies and custom scopes, coordinating directly with application development teams and enterprise architecture. Team Members collaborate daily for IAM System design and implementation, as well as assist with operational support in Identity and Access related functions.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Administration and configuration of our IAM products and processes with an emphasis on SailPoint Identity products.</li><li>Developing custom integration, workflows and rules between tools using Agile methodologies.</li><li>Planning, implementation, enforcement and review of security policies, procedures, and controls specific to Identity Access Management.</li><li>Processing access requests and issue tickets for internal and external customers</li><li>Leading troubleshooting and resolution of system issues that might contribute to enterprise Production problems.</li><li>Managing project work through all phases (design, build, test, cutover).</li><li>Report on controls, evidence gathering and control execution.</li><li>Work collaboratively across IT and Business departments to implement technical solutions</li><li>Under limited direction from management, monitor, evaluate and maintain systems and procedures to enforce best practices for user access authorization and control.</li><li>Research, recommend, and implement changes to procedures and systems to enhance systems security.</li><li>Assist in communicating security policies and procedures to users.</li><li>Assist internal and external customers with multi-platform security access issues and requests.</li><li>Assist in identifying or developing tools or methods to track and monitor risk</li><li>Support management with special projects and other duties as assigned</li><li>Report on controls, evidence gathering and control execution.</li><li>Work collaboratively across IT and Business departments to implement technical solutions</li><li>Under limited direction from management, monitor, evaluate and maintain systems and procedures to enforce best practices for user access authorization and control.</li><li>Research, recommend, and implement changes to procedures and systems to enhance systems security.</li><li>Assist in communicating security policies and procedures to users.</li><li>Assist internal and external customers with multi-platform security access issues and requests.</li><li>Assist in identifying or developing tools or methods to track and monitor risk</li><li>Support management with special projects and other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Microsoft Active Directory and LDAP</li><li>Experience working in and developing solutions for a highly regulated environment or organization that leverages a security framework (such as NIST, COBIT, etc).</li><li>Experience supporting the ForgeRock Identity Platform including Identity Gateway, Access Manager, and Directory Server.</li><li>Experience with Multi-Factor authentication protocols and systems (Entrust, Duo, or similar).</li><li>Experience with Single-Sign on protocols (OIDC, OAuth2.0, SAML, SWA, etc) and systems (Okta, Ping, Siteminder, or similar).</li><li>Development experience: Java, Javascript, Groovy</li><li>Development experience: Python and Shell Scripting</li><li>Solid understanding of Encryption and Network protocols (SSL, IPV4, HTTP)</li><li>Basic knowledge of Linux operating system administration.</li><li>Basic knowledge of Windows server and desktop operating systems</li><li>Basic knowledge of Amazon Web Services (AWS)</li><li>Basic knowledge of Controls, Risk Ranking/mapping, Remediation items and general IT audit</li><li>Preferred (nice to have)</li><li>Sailpoint Identity IQ administration or experience</li><li>E-GRC/Archer</li><li>ServiceNow</li><li>Mainframe architecture</li><li>CA-ACF2 Mainframe access control facilities</li><li>Directory services, LDAP, and their inherent security (Active Directory, CA Directory).</li><li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other related field, or equivalent experience </li><li>7+ Years Identity Access Management (IAM) experience preferred</li><li>Hands-on IT or security operations experience</li><li>Industry recognized certifications (CISSP, ITIL, etc)</li></ul>

information<p><br></p><strong><u>Legal Name</u></strong><p><br></p>Location (City and State):<p><br></p>Relocate?<p><br></p><strong><u>Rate</u></strong><p><br></p>Availability:<p><br></p>Phone it?<p><br></p>Are you working directly with the contractors visa holder?<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Role Summary/Purpose</li></ul><p><br></p>The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for working with cross-functional team members to create, implement, and maintain the overall Software Factory for continuous Build, Test, and Deployment of Software Application products.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Roles and Responsibilities<p><br></p><strong><u>In This Role, You Will</u></strong><p><br></p>Contribute to product engineering by owning, contributing in a team to design DevOps software development and release automation framework and features.<p><br></p>Build expertise and an SME for DevOps CI CD automation<p><br></p>Collaborates in design reviews with product and test automation engineering teams to ensure integration with DevOps.<p><br></p>Owns and contributes to the overall DevOps backlog to implement end to end solutions for software engineering, integration, delivery, and deployment automation.<p><br></p>Focusses on scale and efficiency and driving consistent, reliable, scalable, and sustainable DevOps processes across environments.<p><br></p>Work closely with stakeholders across product teams in driving technology initiatives such as bringing state-of-art technologies, tools, standards, and processes to ensure efficiency &amp; quality of delivery.<p><br></p>Develop and enhance the DevOps infrastructure with continuous integration, test, deployment, and monitoring framework used across teams.<p><br></p>Demonstrate expertise and specialist in developing and executing automation builds and scripts using software development best practices.<p><br></p>Partner with fellow team members to diagnose issues and formulate solutions.<p><br></p>Continuously improve with adopting industry standard methodologies to improve build, release and continuous integration and deployment processes.<p><br></p>Learn new build and releases tools, processes, techniques &amp; methodologies and work closely with Architects and Leads in implementing technology initiatives following Software development practices.<p><br></p>Learn and follow relevant quality management systems and process to ensure product engineering meets highest standards of quality.<p><br></p>Demonstrate expertise in writing scripts to automate tasks. Implements Continuous Integration/Deployment build principles<p><br></p>Education Qualification<p><br></p>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science/ Applications.<p><br></p>Minimum 4+ experience in DevOps<p><br></p>Desired Characteristics<p><br></p><strong><u>Technical Expertise</u></strong><p><br></p>Experience with creating and maintaining automated build tools<p><br></p>OS: Linux, Windows<p><br></p>Build Orchestrator: Jenkins, Git CICD or equivalent<p><br></p>SCM: Git or equivalent<p><br></p>Artifact Management: Artifactory or equivalent<p><br></p>Process: GitOps, GitFlow, Branching, Versioning, Tagging, Release<p><br></p>Automation Tools: Ansible, Chef, Vault<p><br></p>Quality: Sonar<p><br></p>Programming: Shell, Python, Groovy<p><br></p>Optional - Containers/ Virtualization: Docker, Kubernetes, VMWare<p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>Jenkins, CI/CD , Artifactory, Perforce, GitLab, Coverity, Valgrind, GCov, Sonar<p><br></p>ERM Miguelangel Buonafina | *** |North America<p><br></p>Tel.: +*** Ext 13578

Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Mobile Engineer
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - Work from anywhere (TimeZone: CST | Partial overlap)</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $50 – $70/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 20h/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>Portfolio of projects: assigned and passion projects to show. We want to see what kind of ideas a person is playing with and how they thought about the execution process and what they learned.</li><li>Curious</li><li>Deep thinker</li><li>High integrity</li><li>Can handle uncertainty and can concretize loose specifications</li><li>Long-term thinker. </li><li>Thoughtful </li></ul> <strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong>Decentralized autonomous organizations (DAO) don’t exist, but they should. Our client hope to build the first of many sustainable DAOs. No blockchain has figured this out. The world-wide web was supposed to be decentralized, but is now more centralized than ever before. Without governance and cultural considerations, technologies are easily abused and used in ways absolutely antithetical to the design intent over time. Their techno-social solution addresses the problem of what it would take to actually create a decentralized Web 3.0.<br><br><strong>First Deliverables:<br></strong><ul><li>1: Architecture finalization [April] </li><li>2: Iterative buildout of prototype in a closed network and desktop browser only. [Mid-June] </li><li>3: Iterative buildout of prototype in a open network and upgradability mechanisms. [Mid - Oct] <br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6483<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Ability to become self-sufficient in an area of the system with a high-level understanding of other components.</li><li>Able to take ownership of small-to-medium features from technical design through completion</li><li>Partner closely with the Technology team and senior leadership</li><li>Finalize the projects in a timely manner</li><li>Work with algo trading team on the internally developed eTrading platform</li><li>Support existing software</li><li>Learn quickly and make daily progress without the need for constant, significant feedback from more senior engineers.<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree or above in Computer Science or related field</li><li>At least 10+ years of experience as a Software Developer / Engineer</li><li>Strong experience with C#/ .NET- Minimum 10 years</li><li>Ability to work in a fast paced environment</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br></strong><ul><li>Top of the market salary, based upon experience</li><li>Excellent total comp package with benefits</li><li>401k match, and Health-care / Medical Insurances</li><li>Very generous PTO, sick, mental and holiday time-off<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. title: US_West | Platform Engineer - DevOps_L2
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company. Driven by its purpose of Breaking New Ground, which centers on Innovation, Sustainability and Productivity, the Company provides the strategic direction, R&amp;D capabilities, and investments that enable the success of its five core Brands: Case IH, New Holland Agriculture, STEYR, CASE and New Holland Construction Equipment. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial’s 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive work environment, passionate about empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world.<p><br></p>We are seeking an experienced Salesforce Architect to lead our Salesforce platform design and implementation initiatives. As a Salesforce Architect, you will be responsible for understanding the business requirements, designing the architecture, and implementing solutions that meet the company's needs. Your role will involve working closely with multi-functional teams, including developers, project managers, and stakeholders to ensure the CNH is demonstrating and optimizing the Salesforce platform to meet business needs.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li> Lead the design and architecture of the Salesforce platform, including solutions for integration, data migration, and customization </li><li> Collaborate with business stakeholders and solution owners to understand business requirements and translate them into Salesforce solutions </li><li> Create technical specifications, diagrams, and documentation to support development teams </li><li> Manage the development lifecycle, including the creation of project plans, estimating timelines, and tracking progress against achievements </li><li> Provide guidance and mentorship to development teams, ensuring they follow best practices and adhere to architectural standards </li><li> Conduct code reviews to ensure quality and maintainability of code </li><li> Participate in system testing, user acceptance testing, and deployment activities </li><li> Stay up-to-date with the latest Salesforce technologies and trends, and find opportunities for improvement to the Salesforce platform <br></li></ul><p><br></p>Position Pays $109,000 and 167,000. (Actual salaries will vary and will be based on various factors, such as skill, experience, and qualification for the role.)<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related field </li><li> Minimum 5 years of experience leading, designing and implementing CRM Solutions </li><li> Minimum of 3 years’ experience leading Salesforce implementation </li><li> Salesforce Certified System Architect <br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventive care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.<p><br></p>

title: Application Engineer
description: Description <br><br>The Onyx Cloud Engineer will be a subject matter/domain expert with specific expertise with AWS at a minimum, requisite for the position to that of a DevOps/GitOps Cloud Engineer, in a hands-on capacity, with working knowledge and understanding centered around the following areas:<br><ul><li> GitOps, DevOps, and ChatOps principles and best practices</li><li> AWS managed services, included but not limited to EKS, ECR, RDS, KMS, IAM,VPC, Lambda, Route 53, ALB, ELB, Dynamo DB, EC2, S3, SNS, SQS, EBS, Transit Gateway, Direct Connect, network access control list, and security groups</li><li> Kubernetes (EKS preferred)</li><li> Helm Charts/Helm Files</li><li> IaC (Terraform)</li><li> IDP (Azure AD*)</li><li> SEIM</li><li> Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Continuous Delivery concepts and supporting commercial and OSS tooling, including but not limited Jenkins, Jfrog Artifactory &amp; Xray, SonarQube, Harness*, Spinnaker*, and ArgoCD*</li><li> Pipeline as Code</li><li> Continuous Observability specific to logging, monitoring, and tracing leveraging OSS tooling such as: Splunk, Dynatrace, Prometheus, Grafana, Fluentd, Kuberhealthy*, and Open Telemetry* as well as AWS managed services such as CloudWatch<br><br></li></ul> Skills <br><br>Aws, kubernetes, terraform, Cloud, splunk, dynatrace, kuberhealthy, open telemetry<br><br> Top Skills Details <br><br>Aws, kubernetes, terraform, Cloud<br><br> Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications <br><ul><li> Defines the set of declarative modules for infrastructure provisioning via Terraform Enterprise for the design, build, and implementation of the Onyx Cloud Platform, hosted on AWS</li><li> Drives industry best practices and approaches to implementing infrastructure as code (IaC) specific to Kubernetes infrastructure provisioning</li><li> Actively engages and participates in both internal and external technology forums related to Terraform, Kubernetes and DevOps/GitOps initiatives</li><li> Provides sound recommendations in order to improve and/or implement best practices for supporting Onyx Toolchain strategy and initiatives</li><li> Hands-on keyboard coding required<br><br></li></ul> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Application Engineer
description: <strong>Position: </strong> Software Engineer<p><br></p><strong>Duration: </strong>6-12 months<p><br></p><strong>Location: </strong> Chicago, IL 60606 - hybrid onsite 3 days a week<p><br></p>I am looking for a Software Engineer with expertise in Java and Informatica to join a Data Platform Architecture team.<p><br></p>As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for fine-tuning the Service Layer of our software applications, ensuring their optimal performance and seamless integration. Your primary focus will be on utilizing Java and Informatica to enhance and optimize the service layer components of our systems.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop, enhance, and maintain the service layer components of our software applications using Java and Informatica.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, designers, and other developers, to understand requirements and design efficient solutions.</li><li>Fine-tune the service layer to improve performance, scalability, and reliability of our applications.</li><li>Identify and resolve bottlenecks, bugs, and performance issues in the service layer code.</li><li>Conduct code reviews to ensure adherence to coding standards, best practices, and quality guidelines.</li><li>Work closely with database administrators and backend developers to integrate the service layer with backend systems and databases.</li><li>Implement and maintain integrations with external systems using Informatica.</li><li>Optimize data flows and transformations within the service layer to ensure efficient data processing and accurate results.</li><li>Stay updated with the latest industry trends, tools, and technologies related to Java, Informatica, and service layer development.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field. A relevant master’s degree is a plus.</li><li>Proven experience as a Software Engineer, with a focus on developing and fine-tuning the service layer using Java and Informatica.</li><li>Strong proficiency in Java programming language and related frameworks (e.g., Spring, Spring Boot framework, Hibernate). </li><li>Hands on experience in data pipeline development using modern ETL tools specifically on Informatica PowerCenter and/or Informatica IICS</li><li>Solid understanding of service-oriented architecture (SOA) concepts and RESTful web services.</li><li>Proficiency in SQL and Scripting (Unix shell and /or Python)</li><li>Familiarity with performance optimization techniques and tools for Java applications.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.</li><li>Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively within a team.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and their related services.</li><li>Knowledge of big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data analytics concepts.</li><li>Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).</li><li>Understanding of DevOps practices and tools for continuous integration and deployment. </li></ul><p><br></p><em>Did you know about Sterling? As a Sterling contract W2 employee you are become an owner in Sterling. We are an Employee-Owned ESOP (Employee Stock Option Program) Company that itself is an additional retirement benefit on top of our other exceptional Sterling benefits, including paid holidays, PTO, the ability to join the 401K with a company match. Sterling Engineering / Staffing could be your future home.</em><p><br></p><strong>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.</strong><p><br></p><strong>#SP</strong>

A relevant master’s degree is a plus.</li><li>Proven experience as a Software Engineer, with a focus on developing and fine-tuning the service layer using Java and Informatica.</li><li>Strong proficiency in Java programming language and related frameworks (e.g., Spring, Spring Boot framework, Hibernate). </li><li>Hands on experience in data pipeline development using modern ETL tools specifically on Informatica PowerCenter and/or Informatica IICS</li><li>Solid understanding of service-oriented architecture (SOA) concepts and RESTful web services.</li><li>Proficiency in SQL and Scripting (Unix shell and /or Python)</li><li>Familiarity with performance optimization techniques and tools for Java applications.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.</li><li>Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively within a team.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and their related services.</li><li>Knowledge of big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data analytics concepts.</li><li>Experience with containerization and orchestration technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).</li><li>Understanding of DevOps practices and tools for continuous integration and deployment. </li></ul><p><br></p><em>Did you know about Sterling? As a Sterling contract W2 employee you are become an owner in Sterling. We are an Employee-Owned ESOP (Employee Stock Option Program) Company that itself is an additional retirement benefit on top of our other exceptional Sterling benefits, including paid holidays, PTO, the ability to join the 401K with a company match. Sterling Engineering / Staffing could be your future home.</em><p><br></p><strong>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.</strong><p><br></p><strong>#SP</strong>

title: Application Engineer
description: At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>Northrop Grumman Space Systems designs, builds and delivers space, defense and aviation-related systems to customers around the world. Our main products include launch vehicles and related propulsion systems; missile products, subsystems and defense electronics; precision weapons, armament systems and ammunition; satellites and associated space components and services; and advanced aerospace structures.<br><br>Our Systems Engineering Integration &amp; Test (SEIT) organization, within Payload &amp; Ground Systems Division (PGSD), provides complex subsystems and defense electronics. This position can be hired as a Systems Engineer/ Principal Systems Engineer in either of the following 2 disciplines: (1) Systems Design or (2) Modelling &amp; Simulation.<br><br>This position is located at our Rolling Meadows, IL location.<br><br>As a part of the SEIT team, a Systems Design engineer is exposed to the front end Systems Engineering process and coordinates across many disciplines to ensure that the system description and requirements are properly and thoroughly defined, captured, and meet the mission need for the end customer.<br><br><strong><u>Tasking For Systems Design Can Include<br></u></strong><ul><li>creating and refining Model Based System Engineering products (System behavioral models, Use Case realizations, State Machines, etc.)</li><li>generation and update of specifications in DOORS, including requirements traceability and dxl script development</li><li>capability assessments to predict requirement compliance</li><li>functional algorithm development</li><li>risk assessment and burn down of mitigation steps</li><li>generating and reporting system Technical Performance Measures</li><li>presenting analysis that shapes the system design and obtaining end-customer buy-in</li><li>Interface development and documentation</li><li>Cyber Security/Information Assurance Support, including the RMF implementation</li></ul>As part of the SEIT team, a Modeling &amp; Simulation Engineer is exposed to the full life-cycle of Systems Engineering process and coordinates across many disciplines to ensure that the system is modeled with sufficient fidelity. In the early stages of programs, modeling &amp; simulation is leveraged to understand system CONOPs, inform system architecture, and perform trades. In the later stages as the design matures, field test data is used to verify and validate the models and ensure the payload models are representative of actual performance.<br><br><strong><u>Tasking For Modelling And Simulation Can Include<br></u></strong><ul><li>Software development of physics-based in-house models and algorithms</li><li>Perform analysis and trades of product line architectures using analytical models and mission level simulations</li><li>Functional algorithm development</li><li>Authoring technical documentation such as white papers, proposal technical volumes, program milestone briefings (i.e. SRR, PDR, CDR,...), systems engineering design documentation</li><li>Presenting technical analysis to multiple stakeholders</li><li>Creating and refining Model Based Systems Engineering Products (System behavioral models, Use Case realizations, State Machines, etc.)</li></ul>In addition, the ideal candidate has recent experience in the fields of either EOIR, RF systems, or both. Specifically, the ideal candidate will have experience in the following specialties.<br><ul><li>Advanced knowledge and recent experience in one or more of the following areas: EOIR/RF systems: sensors/antennas, transmitters/receivers, lasers, LiDAR, optics, visible and IR cameras, focal plane arrays.</li><li>Real-time signal processing</li><li>Requirements analysis and allocation as related to Systems Engineering</li></ul><strong> Additional $10k sign-on bonus for selected candidates who possess an ACTIVE TS/SCI clearance, and an additional $5k sign-on bonuses to selected candidates who possess an active Polygraph. <br><br></strong><strong><u>Basic Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Principal Engineer- BS degree in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics or related technical degree with 5+ years (or MS with 3+ years, or PhD with 0 years) related experience</li><li>Systems Engineer- BS degree in Aerospace Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Physics or related technical degree with 2+ years (or MS with 0 years) related experience</li><li>Theoretical knowledge of the System Engineering V-Model and hands on experience executing the systems engineering work flow </li><li>Demonstrated analytical thinking, problem solving skills, and creativity</li><li>Excellent decision making and communication (written and oral) skills</li><li>Team players with a strong work ethic and initiative to perform in a cross functional team</li><li>Ability to obtain Top Secret/SCI level accesses</li></ul><strong> Preferred Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li>Active Top Secret Clearance with SCI &amp; polygraph is preferred</li><li>Working knowledge of RF sensors/antennas, transmitters/receivers </li><li>Experience with real-time signal processing in both firmware and software</li><li>Advanced knowledge of orbital mechanics, dynamics and controls, rendezvous and proximity operations (RPO), orbit determination, and attitude planning</li><li>Knowledgeable in orbit planning in LEO, GEO and cislunar regimes</li><li>Knowledgeable in the use of COTS tools such as AGI's Systems Tool Kit (STK) and Orbital Determination Tool Kit (ODTK)</li><li>Full life cycle experience developing, integrating, and deploying space systems</li><li>Knowledgeable in space systems design and mission planning</li><li>Experience in specification development and requirements derivation using DOORS</li><li>Experience deploying innovative modeling methods for Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) using tools like Cameo</li><li>Knowledge of MATLAB, SysML, Python, or other scripting languages</li><li>Recent experience creating integration and test, design verification test and flight test plans and procedures</li><li>Ability and willingness to travel up to 15%</li><li>Experience working in an Agile environment</li><li>CompTIA Security+ Certification</li><li>Experience as a system administrator, security engineer, Information Systems Security Officer (ISSO), or other role supporting a system Authorization to Operate (ATO)</li></ul> <strong>Salary Range: </strong> $81,000 USD - $121,600 USD<br><br><strong>Salary Range 2: </strong> $99,800 USD - $149,800 USD<br><br>Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.<br><br><strong>The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority</strong>. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ .<br><br>Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

title: Software Prototype Developer [Remote]
description: <strong>Job#: 1349918<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description:<br><br></strong><strong>Infrastructure Engineer<br><br></strong>REMOTE<br><br>Apex Systems, the Nation’s 2nd largest Technical Staffing and Services Firm, has an opening for an Infrastructure Engineer for a Large Mobile Network Operator company in Chicago for a 11-month contract plus extensions.<br><br>Please email resume in WORD format to Ly, <strong>ladorno@apexsystems.com<br><br></strong><u><strong>Role Specific Responsibilities<br></strong></u><ul><li>Identify changes needed in the infrastructure configuration to achieve the technology organization goals</li><li>Define aggregate demand data in support of budget plans and make recommendations for ways to improve performance and / reduce costs</li><li>Supports the infrastructure strategy reviews and development by performing applicable analysis</li><li>Provide project management oversight to infrastructure implementation projects.</li><li>Implements technology and infrastructure changes for platforms, performance and scoring.</li><li>Analyzes system response and determines tuning recommendations to improve performance.</li><li>Lead effective issue identification and resolution process; serve as the focal point for infrastructure-related issue / crisis resolution</li><li>See opportunities to save costs and more effectively handle assets</li><li>Ensure communication of process and procedure changes to key stakeholders</li><li>Design an effective test plan for any new / changed infrastructure technology and work with Project Managers, QA / Testing</li><li>Managers and Release Managers to ensure its implementation before the client takes possession of the system</li><li>Support identification and collection of metrics and performance reporting processes</li><li>Monitors delivery against SLAs and reports exceptions to management</li><li>Participate in process improvement initiatives, when applicable</li><li>Business Partnership</li><li>Maintain contact with the business users to proactively identify needed changes</li><li>Establish working relationships with technical, business and sourcing counterparts</li><li>Participate in process improvement initiatives</li><li>People Management</li><li>Handle individual workload and deliver to agreed upon milestones</li><li>Proactively promote consistent project-based performance measurement and skill development of junior staff</li><li>Actively participate in HR performance measurement processes</li><li>Demonstrate ability to work in team environment and help resolve issues</li><li>Provide input to staffing plans at the project-level to identify key / required skills<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>College degree in related technical / business areas or equivalent work experience</li><li>Understanding of the technology organization and / or business and technology</li><li>Re-engineering / process improvement experience, leading and coaching quality improvement projects</li><li>Strong change management skills; change agent</li><li>Excellent problem solving / analytical skills and knowledge of analytical tools</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Ability to create / define metrics that accurately reflects the current state of a given process</li><li>Knowledge of Six Sigma, CMM and other relevant methodologies<br><br></li></ul>EEO Employer<br><br>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at employeeservices@apexsystems.com or 844-463-6178.<br><br>Apex Systems is a world-class IT services company that serves thousands of clients across the globe. When you join Apex, you become part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. We offer quality career resources, training, certifications, development opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package. Our commitment to excellence is reflected in many awards, including ClearlyRated's Best of Staffing® in Talent Satisfaction in the United States and Great Place to Work® in the United Kingdom and Mexico.<br><br>Apex Systems is a world-class IT services company that serves thousands of clients across the globe. When you join Apex, you become part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. We offer quality career resources, training, certifications, development opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package. Our commitment to excellence is reflected in many awards, including ClearlyRated's Best of Staffing® in Talent Satisfaction in the United States and Great Place to Work® in the United Kingdom and Mexico.<br><br>4400 Cox Road<br><br>Suite 200<br><br>Glen Allen, Virginia 23060<br><br>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. title: Software Engineer - Chicago Hybrid
description: At Iron Galaxy Studios, our teams support a healthy work-life balance, promote continuous improvement, and champion a diverse people-focused culture. We encourage Engineers from every heritage, lifestyle, or background to apply.<p><br></p>This is a full-time hybrid position in Orlando (FL), Chicago (IL), Nashville (TN), or Austin (TX) with relocation options for out-of-state applicants.<p><br></p>Software Engineers at Iron Galaxy work on a wide variety of projects, including creating new games from the ground up, co-developing games with partners, and porting existing games to new platforms. Our projects tend to have shorter development cycles; it’s not uncommon for a software engineer to work on more than one project in a year. We’ve found that this helps keep things fresh and provides opportunities to utilize experience gained from previous projects.<p><br></p>As a Software Engineer at Iron Galaxy, you’ll get the chance to help architect and implement features and systems, debug difficult problems, and tackle new challenges. In addition to their technical skills, our software engineers typically have strong communication skills and work well with diverse cross-functional teams. This is a mid-level position. Candidates should have a solid knowledge of game development. Responsibilities vary based on the project and expertise. Here are some examples of what a Software Engineer might be expected to do at Iron Galaxy Studios.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Implement new features or systems</li><li>Assist in the creation of technical design documents for new systems</li><li>Review game design documents and provide feedback</li><li>Implement low-level subsystems for new platforms</li><li>Ensure adherence to platform compliance requirements</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience at a game studio (any size)</li><li>Solid understanding of C/C++</li><li>Desire to learn and grow</li><li>Strong debugging skills</li><li>Able to adapt to new codebases and platforms</li></ul><p><br></p>If you have not worked in a professional capacity as a software engineer in game development, please describe how your programming skills from your experience will translate to this position in your cover letter.<p><br></p>ABOUT US: Iron Galaxy is one of the world’s largest independent video game developers with 60+ shipped titles. Our people combine their talents to create amazing ports, epic remasters, and new experiences from the ground up. We partner with the top companies in the gaming industry to co-develop and support AAA game creation at the highest level. See why we have been certified by Great Place to Work (https://www.greatplacetowork.com/certified-company/7027205) and GamesIndustry.biz (https://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/2021-07-22-best-places-to-work-awards-winner-iron-galaxy) .<p><br></p>Iron Galaxy Studios is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that a diverse workforce and an inclusive work environment are essential to making quality games. Our teams actively support equal access to career opportunities for all people regardless of age, race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, national origin, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.<p><br></p>We prohibit retaliation against individuals who present discrimination complaints to Iron Galaxy management or relevant government agencies. We strongly encourage women, people of color, individuals with disabilities, and veterans to apply.<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR
description_json: At Iron Galaxy Studios, our teams support a healthy work-life balance, promote continuous improvement, and champion a diverse people-focused culture. We encourage Engineers from every heritage, lifestyle, or background to apply.<p><br></p>This is a full-time hybrid position in Orlando (FL), Chicago (IL), Nashville (TN), or Austin (TX) with relocation options for out-of-state applicants.<p><br></p>Software Engineers at Iron Galaxy work on a wide variety of projects, including creating new games from the ground up, co-developing games with partners, and porting existing games to new platforms. Our projects tend to have shorter development cycles; it’s not uncommon for a software engineer to work on more than one project in a year. We’ve found that this helps keep things fresh and provides opportunities to utilize experience gained from previous projects.<p><br></p>As a Software Engineer at Iron Galaxy, you’ll get the chance to help architect and implement features and systems, debug difficult problems, and tackle new challenges. In addition to their technical skills, our software engineers typically have strong communication skills and work well with diverse cross-functional teams. This is a mid-level position. Candidates should have a solid knowledge of game development. Responsibilities vary based on the project and expertise. Here are some examples of what a Software Engineer might be expected to do at Iron Galaxy Studios.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Implement new features or systems</li><li>Assist in the creation of technical design documents for new systems</li><li>Review game design documents and provide feedback</li><li>Implement low-level subsystems for new platforms</li><li>Ensure adherence to platform compliance requirements</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience at a game studio (any size)</li><li>Solid understanding of C/C++</li><li>Desire to learn and grow</li><li>Strong debugging skills</li><li>Able to adapt to new codebases and platforms</li></ul><p><br></p>If you have not worked in a professional capacity as a software engineer in game development, please describe how your programming skills from your experience will translate to this position in your cover letter.<p><br></p>ABOUT US: Iron Galaxy is one of the world’s largest independent video game developers with 60+ shipped titles. Our people combine their talents to create amazing ports, epic remasters, and new experiences from the ground up. We partner with the top companies in the gaming industry to co-develop and support AAA game creation at the highest level. See why we have been certified by Great Place to Work (https://www.greatplacetowork.com/certified-company/7027205) and GamesIndustry.biz (https://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/2021-07-22-best-places-to-work-awards-winner-iron-galaxy) .<p><br></p>Iron Galaxy Studios is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that a diverse workforce and an inclusive work environment are essential to making quality games. Our teams actively support equal access to career opportunities for all people regardless of age, race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, veteran status, national origin, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.<p><br></p>We prohibit retaliation against individuals who present discrimination complaints to Iron Galaxy management or relevant government agencies. We strongly encourage women, people of color, individuals with disabilities, and veterans to apply.<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR

title: Salesforce Architect
description: At CLA we create inspired careers.<br><br>CLA, one of the nation’s largest public accounting and professional services firm is currently seeking a <strong>Quality Assurance Analyst</strong> to join the growing Internal IT team.<br><br>The Role of the Quality Assurance (QA) Analyst is to work alongside our product owners, business analysts, developers, and business stakeholders to identify, design, create and execute appropriate test cases to ensure the delivery of high-quality products and services. As a QA Analyst you will assist the Quality Assurance team in the development and adherence to quality standard and software development best practices such as Agile/Scrum development practices, Release Management and Testing Automation.<br><br><strong><u>Essential Job Functions<br></u></strong><ul><li> Assist Quality Assurance team members with writing test cases that map approved business requirements to the application or solution being delivered</li><li> Ensure test artifacts, communication and test results are clearly documented in the tracking system, Azure DevOps.</li><li> Assist the Quality Assurance team with a bug identification. Assist with triage, troubleshooting and issue resolution.</li><li> Provide information and recommendations of current state of quality by analyzing and summarizing findings based on output of automation, compile documentation of progress and results.</li><li> Stay current with researching new testing technologies and improving existing solutions.</li><li> Adapt quickly to changing requirements, scope, or priorities.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Experience<br></u></strong><ul><li> Two plus years of experience administrating/supporting line of business or administrative applications.</li><li> Fundamental understanding of programming languages, examples include Python, Power Scripting, JavaScript, or SQL.</li><li> Experience within testing software applications is preferred. At least one year of experience working in Software Development Life Cycle.<br></li></ul><strong>Education<br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree or experience acceptable in lieu of bachelor’s degree.<br></li></ul>Equal Opportunity Employer /AA Employer/Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.<br><br>Click here to learn about your hiring rights.<br><br><strong>Wellness at CLA<br><br></strong>To support our CLA family members, we focus on their physical, financial, social, and emotional well-being and offer comprehensive benefit options that include health, dental, vision, 401k and much more.<br><br>To view a complete list of benefits click here.<br><br>

title: Onyx Cloud Engineer
description: <ul><li>Looking for a new Electronics Testing position? *</li><li>I have the one for you!* My client is currently hiring for an experienced Test Engineer to develop manufacturing tests to be performed on every unit that they build to make sure it is free of manufacturing flaws. This client manufactures electronics and telematics offerings for the automotive/transportation industry, so we are in need of someone with a manufacturing test experience. This position will be using LabView, Test Stands, along with C# with the flexibility of interchanging these languages.</li><li>Responsibilities:*</li><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to meet product test requirements</li><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and other continuous improvement initiatives</li><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal project stakeholders</li><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those requirements</li><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li><li>Top Skills:*</li><li>Labview</li><li>C#</li><li>Test Stand</li><li>SQL</li><li>Manufacturing Test</li><li>Test Automation</li><li>Test development/design</li><li>Hardware</li><li>Experience developing test for RF or wireless devices</li><li>Employee Perks:*</li><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans</li><li>Abenity Discount Program</li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance</li><li>PTO</li><li>Paid Holiday's</li><li>Experience Level:* 5+ years experience<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Space TS/SCI - Engineer Systems / Principal Engineer Systems (Up to $15k in sign-on bonus for eligible candidates!)
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote-United States only (TimeZone: EST | Partial overlap)</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $100 – $112/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Qualities that will help you thrive in this role are:<br></strong><ul><li>You have familiarity with some of the following: Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, such as Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP), creating dashboards in tools such as Looker or Tableau for monitoring and insights, building and monitoring cloud services, infrastructure as code technologies such as Terraform, AWS Cloud Formation, Ansible, etc, Big Data experience with tools such as Spark.</li><li>You understand that being an effective software engineer is about communicating with people as much as it is about writing code</li><li>You are generous with your time and experience, and can mentor and learn from other engineers</li><li>You can tackle unconstrained problems and know when to seek help</li><li>You are flexible with languages and tools and willing to learn whatever is necessary to complete the job.</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong><strong>What’s the role?<br><br></strong>Our client's Data Enablement organization's mission is to enable the use of data at scale and to unlock learning through experimentation. As part of the Data Governance &amp; Privacy team, you will join a highly visible team with a top priority of protecting sensitive information of our client's buyers and sellers. The team is responsible for building services and processes to protect Personally Identifiable Information (PII) in their data warehouses. You'll be part of our client's journey to modernize how they protect personal data<br><br>They work with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, such as Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP). Languages include Java, Python, PHP and SQL, and they work with technologies like Terraform, Spark, Airflow, and BigQuery. Experience with any of these is helpful but not required; above all, they value curiosity, responsibility, and eagerness to solve complex engineering problems. They're looking for a flexible engineer, who can work with the internal customers, and embraces pivoting to the appropriate tool for the job rather than having deep expertise in single systems<br><br>The technical staff believes that code is craft, and that the work they do is part of a larger creative culture that includes the hundreds of thousands of inspired artists and designers who make the Company such a unique marketplace. They believe that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things. They believe in measuring everything, taking advantage of their continuous deployment system to ship code early and often, and keeping up a blameless culture based on trust and a commitment to learning.<br><br>This is a position reporting to the Engineering Manager, Data Governance &amp; Privacy. For this role, they are considering candidates who are either remote, flex, or office-based. The team is geographically dispersed, but works in North America Time Zones<br><br><strong>What does the day-to-day look like?<br></strong><ul><li>You will build and maintain internal tools for tracking and inventorying GCS file sets using Google Storage Insight</li><li>You will work with your team to develop methods to programmatically apply column tags and Policy Tags on BigQuery data sets to identify and protect Personally Identifiable Information</li><li>You will help measure the team’s progress in our work by creating dashboards and monitoring in tools such as Looker or Tableau<br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6589<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.
