title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Work in Sweden</strong><p><br></p>Our job offerings are temporarily remote from your home country, but then we will help you migrate to a fantastic country, Sweden! We will provide you with a work permit and an exciting job opportunity.<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>As an Automotive Android Developer, you will be crucial in designing, developing, and maintaining Android-based applications and frameworks of automotive systems and infotainment platforms.<p><br></p>Your primary responsibilities will be:<p><br></p><ul><li>Design and develop Android-based software solutions for automotive applications, including infotainment, navigation, and driver assistance systems.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, UX/UI designers, and automotive engineers, to define requirements, design specifications, and system architecture.</li><li>Implement robust and scalable code following best practices, coding standards, and industry guidelines, ensuring high performance and reliability.</li><li>Optimize and enhance existing Android frameworks and libraries to improve system performance, responsiveness, and user experience.</li><li>Conduct thorough testing and debugging of Android applications to identify and resolve software defects, ensuring high-quality deliverables.</li><li>Stay up-to-date with Android development trends, frameworks, and technologies, and apply them to improve software development processes and outcomes.</li><li>Participate in code reviews to ensure high standards, maintainability, and performance requirements.</li><li>Collaborate with the QA team to define and execute effective testing strategies and ensure software reliability and stability.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Need</strong><p><br></p>A passionate engineer for automotive technology and a desire to innovate in the field of connected cars and autonomous vehicles with the following:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. A master's degree is a plus.</li><li>Proven experience in Android application development, with 5+ years of experience in automotive software development.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Android SDK, Java, Kotlin, and other relevant programming languages for Android development.</li><li>Experience with Android frameworks and libraries commonly used in automotive applications, such as Android Auto, Android Automotive OS (GAS (Google automotive services)), and Android Open Source Project (AOSP).</li><li>Familiarity with automotive industry standards and protocols and diagnostics.</li><li>Proficiency in using Java, Kotlin, and RTOS.</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.</li><li>Proficiency in spoken and written English at an advanced level.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>We are offering more than just a new job position. We help you to build a new exciting life in one of the world's most innovative and technologically developed countries. Sweden is a creative and trending developer where companies excel in making new features to make life easier and sustainable for humans and the planet. Companies in Sweden offer different benefits to their employees, like respecting working hours, vacations, and special permits to maintain a balance between work and family life.<p><br></p>Our client is an international technology company with the vision of helping their customers, transforming technology into great user experiences with physical and digital solutions.<p><br></p>Do you feel ready to become part of an experienced and innovative company with reliable performance in the real world? Do you want to build the future? If you are a talented engineer, this is the opportunity to work for constantly innovating companies and do your part to improve the world.

title: Software Engineer
description: CNC PROGRAMMER<br><br><strong>Dynomax, Inc</strong> is expanding! We are adding brand new, state of the art CNC Machines and are seeking a skilled<strong> Mastercam</strong><strong> Programmer</strong>. This will be a dedicated Programmer 100% of the time.<br><br><strong><u>What We Are Looking For<br></u></strong><ul><li>This is a programming role. Will not be a machinist.</li><li>CNC Programming for 3 Axis Milling Mastercam 2017 or above</li><li>Program complex parts from a blue print</li><li>Create tool sheets and set up instructions with each CNC Program</li><li>Macro Programming: Fanuc, Siemens and Heidenhain</li><li>Read prints and maintain close tolerance dimensional quality in an aerospace tooling and small run production environment</li><li>Work successfully with the process engineers and machine operators to ensure quality parts<br></li></ul><strong><u>Job Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Mastercam Programming experience</li><li>Familiar with speeds and feeds for exotic materials</li><li>Strong understanding of GD&amp;T</li><li>Knowledge of G-Code and M-Code</li><li>Aerospace, Automotive and/or Mold &amp; Tool background</li><li>Ability to work successfully with a team<br></li></ul><strong>What's in it for you?<br></strong><ul><li>A future! As we Dynomax grows, we want you to grow as well</li><li>Working with new state of the art CNC machines in a clean A/C environment</li><li>An environment that encourages strong work ethics and values</li><li>Opportunity for new challenges as we grow</li><li>Great benefits and competitive pay<br></li></ul>At Dynomax, you will not just be another employee – you will be an integral member of the family and team.<br><br><strong><u>Benefits Include<br></u></strong><ul><li>Medical, dental and vision insurance</li><li>Company-paid life insurance</li><li>401(k) Plan with a generous Company match</li><li>Paid holidays, vacation and PTO</li><li>Variety of optional benefits (FSA, AFLAC, etc.)<br></li></ul><em>…And more!<br><br></em><strong>Manufacture a great career with Dynomax!<br><br></strong>Dynomax provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

title: Palo alto Network Engineer
description: <strong>Job Title: Cloud Engineer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL 60603 (3 days onsite)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Contract To Hire<br><br>W2 Only<br><br></strong><strong>The Cloud Engineer will be a subject matter/domain expert with specific expertise with AWS at a minimum, requisite for the position to that of a DevOps/GitOps Cloud Engineer, in a hands-on capacity, with working knowledge and understanding centered around the following areas:<br></strong><ul><li>GitOps, DevOps, and ChatOps principles and best practices</li><li>AWS managed services, included but not limited to EKS, ECR, RDS, KMS, IAM,VPC, Lambda, Route 53, ALB, ELB, Dynamo DB, EC2, S3, SNS, SQS, EBS, Transit Gateway, Direct Connect, network access control list, and security groups</li><li>Kubernetes (EKS preferred)</li><li>Helm Charts/Helm Files</li><li>IaC (Terraform)</li><li>IDP (Azure AD*)</li><li>SEIM</li><li>Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Continuous Delivery concepts and supporting commercial and OSS tooling, including but not limited Jenkins, Jfrog Artifactory &amp; Xray, SonarQube, Harness*, Spinnaker*, and ArgoCD*</li><li>Pipeline as Code</li><li>Continuous Observability specific to logging, monitoring, and tracing leveraging OSS tooling such as: Splunk, Dynatrace, Prometheus, Grafana, Fluentd, Kuberhealthy*, and Open Telemetry* as well as AWS managed services such as CloudWatch<br><br></li></ul><strong>Defines the set of declarative modules for infrastructure provisioning via Terraform Enterprise for the design, build, and implementation of the Onyx Cloud Platform, hosted on AWS<br></strong><ul><li>Drives industry best practices and approaches to implementing infrastructure as code (IaC) specific to Kubernetes infrastructure provisioning</li><li>Actively engages and participates in both internal and external technology forums related to Terraform, Kubernetes and DevOps/GitOps initiatives</li><li>Provides sound recommendations in order to improve and/or implement best practices for supporting Onyx Toolchain strategy and initiatives</li><li>Hands-on keyboard coding required</li></ul>
description_json: <strong>Job Title: Cloud Engineer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL 60603 (3 days onsite)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Contract To Hire<br><br>W2 Only<br><br></strong><strong>The Cloud Engineer will be a subject matter/domain expert with specific expertise with AWS at a minimum, requisite for the position to that of a DevOps/GitOps Cloud Engineer, in a hands-on capacity, with working knowledge and understanding centered around the following areas:<br></strong><ul><li>GitOps, DevOps, and ChatOps principles and best practices</li><li>AWS managed services, included but not limited to EKS, ECR, RDS, KMS, IAM,VPC, Lambda, Route 53, ALB, ELB, Dynamo DB, EC2, S3, SNS, SQS, EBS, Transit Gateway, Direct Connect, network access control list, and security groups</li><li>Kubernetes (EKS preferred)</li><li>Helm Charts/Helm Files</li><li>IaC (Terraform)</li><li>IDP (Azure AD*)</li><li>SEIM</li><li>Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Continuous Delivery concepts and supporting commercial and OSS tooling, including but not limited Jenkins, Jfrog Artifactory &amp; Xray, SonarQube, Harness*, Spinnaker*, and ArgoCD*</li><li>Pipeline as Code</li><li>Continuous Observability specific to logging, monitoring, and tracing leveraging OSS tooling such as: Splunk, Dynatrace, Prometheus, Grafana, Fluentd, Kuberhealthy*, and Open Telemetry* as well as AWS managed services such as CloudWatch<br><br></li></ul><strong>Defines the set of declarative modules for infrastructure provisioning via Terraform Enterprise for the design, build, and implementation of the Onyx Cloud Platform, hosted on AWS<br></strong><ul><li>Drives industry best practices and approaches to implementing infrastructure as code (IaC) specific to Kubernetes infrastructure provisioning</li><li>Actively engages and participates in both internal and external technology forums related to Terraform, Kubernetes and DevOps/GitOps initiatives</li><li>Provides sound recommendations in order to improve and/or implement best practices for supporting Onyx Toolchain strategy and initiatives</li><li>Hands-on keyboard coding required</li></ul>

title: C#/ .NET Developer- Chicago
description: Prestigious Financial Institution is currently seeking a ServiceNow Solutions Engineer. Candidate will provide services to an existing Platform team to architect, design, develop and deploy solutions utilizing the ServiceNow platform. Their deliverables will be focused on development and delivery of value-added integration, out-of-box configuration and consultative services for low code software development. They will collaborate with a team of Engineers to design, deploy and integrate various product capabilities.<p><br></p>Successful execution of delivery on Enterprise Technology Solution epics in-scope for enabling IT Service Management and Security Operations within the ServiceNow platform. This person will provide testing and support for ServiceNow upgrade that we have scheduled in early November, where all functionality has been tested/validated for User Acceptance and any bugs have been fixed. Additionally, Architecture/Designs related to Security Operations and the ITSM in the cloud for our roadmap.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Contribute to design, technical direction, and architecture with various teams to build fit for purpose solutions</li><li>Participates in code reviews, proactively identifying and mitigating potential issues and defects as well as assisting with continuous improvement</li><li>Follows agreed upon SDLC procedures to ensure that all information system products and services meet both explicit and implicit quality standards, end-user functional requirements, architectural standards, performance requirements, audit requirements, security rules are upheld, and external facing reporting is represented</li><li>Writes unit and integration tests to maintain quality technology improvements</li><li>Performs application and project risk analysis and recommends quality improvements</li><li>Manage Production Support on system functionality and provide fixes as required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience in implementing ServiceNow or similar platforms for ITSM, SecOps and/or GRC/IRM modules</li><li>3+ years of experience with Javascript</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON</li><li>Ability to write clean, bug-free code that is easy to understand and easily maintainable</li><li>Strong understanding of CMDB, including importing customer data</li><li>Experience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), Agile/Scrum, and DevSecOps methodologies</li><li>BS degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, similar technical field</li></ul>

Additionally, Architecture/Designs related to Security Operations and the ITSM in the cloud for our roadmap.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Contribute to design, technical direction, and architecture with various teams to build fit for purpose solutions</li><li>Participates in code reviews, proactively identifying and mitigating potential issues and defects as well as assisting with continuous improvement</li><li>Follows agreed upon SDLC procedures to ensure that all information system products and services meet both explicit and implicit quality standards, end-user functional requirements, architectural standards, performance requirements, audit requirements, security rules are upheld, and external facing reporting is represented</li><li>Writes unit and integration tests to maintain quality technology improvements</li><li>Performs application and project risk analysis and recommends quality improvements</li><li>Manage Production Support on system functionality and provide fixes as required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience in implementing ServiceNow or similar platforms for ITSM, SecOps and/or GRC/IRM modules</li><li>3+ years of experience with Javascript</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON</li><li>Ability to write clean, bug-free code that is easy to understand and easily maintainable</li><li>Strong understanding of CMDB, including importing customer data</li><li>Experience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), Agile/Scrum, and DevSecOps methodologies</li><li>BS degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, similar technical field</li></ul>

when required</li><li>Learn and evaluate new technologies/tools as needed</li><li>Ability to debug an issue efficiently Requisite </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>HTTP REST principles and standards</li><li>Object-oriented and functional programming knowledge along with Patterns, Algorithms, Multithreading, Data structures</li><li>Prior hands-on knowledge on Java development</li><li>Focused areas Lambda expressions, Functional interface, var-args , Method references, enum, generics and exception handling</li><li>Programming Language Scala: Focused areas: Java inter-0peration, Type inference, Concurrent/Distributed, Immutability, Lazy evaluations, Classes, Pattern matching, Higher order function, Trait, Collections, Futures, Utils Streams in Java Akka Streams </li><li>The opinionated &amp; reactive Lagom microservices: Focused areas: Akka (scaladsl) and Play</li><li>Remote Procedure Call (RPC) framework: Focused areas: gRPC with Protocol Buffers</li><li>Event-Driven Microservices: Focused areas: Domain-Driven Design (DDD) pattern, Command Query Responsibility Segregation (CQRS), Event-Sourcing (ES) and Apache Pulsar Build Tool - Simple build tool (SBT) Focused areas: Notation, Commands, Settings, Plugins, Scope (multi-module), Dependencies management</li><li>Database access library Slick Database: Focused areas: PostgreSQL and Elastic Store (queries and development) Unit Testing - ScalaTest</li><li>Security Tools: Focused areas: Fortify and Sonatype</li><li>Cloud services on AWS Focused areas: Docker, Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS) and Cloud9</li><li>Development and issue tracking tool - Jira Project management- Scrum Agile: Focused areas: Story/Task writing and estimation</li><li>Development tool (IDE): Focused areas: IntelliJ IDEA hot-keys and controls for Scala development</li><li>Revision control system (VCS): Focused areas: Git commands and dev controls in IDE</li></ul><p><br></p>The Capgemini Freelancer Gateway is enabled by a cutting-edge software platform that leads the contingent labor world for technology innovation. The software platform leverages Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to make sure the right people end up in the right job.<p><br></p>A global leader in consulting, technology services and digital transformation, Capgemini is at the forefront of innovation to address the entire breadth of clients’ opportunities in the evolving world of cloud, digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50 year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise, Capgemini enables organizations to realize their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. It is a multicultural company of over 200,000 team members in more than 40 countries. The Group reported 2018 global revenues of EUR 13.2 billion.<p><br></p>

title: Automotive Android Developer
description: At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. Responsible Growth is how we run our company and how we deliver for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.One of the keys to driving Responsible Growth is being a great place to work for our teammates around the world. We're devoted to being a diverse and inclusive workplace for everyone. We hire individuals with a broad range of backgrounds and experiences and invest heavily in our teammates and their families by offering competitive benefits to support their physical, emotional, and financial well-being.Bank of America believes both in the importance of working together and offering flexibility to our employees. We use a multi-faceted approach for flexibility, depending on the various roles in our organization.Working at Bank of America will give you a great career with opportunities to learn, grow and make an impact, along with the power to make a difference. Join us!Job Description:This role is responsible for developing and delivering complex requirements to accomplish business goals. Key responsibilities of the role include ensuring that software is developed to meet functional/non-functional requirements, coding solutions and unit testing. These individuals are aware of the development practices in the industry.Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Codes solutions and unit test to deliver a requirement/story per the defined acceptance criteria</li><li>Executes automated test suites (integration, regression, performance); collect results and flag issues</li><li>Documents and communicate required information for deployment, maintenance, support, and business functionality</li><li>Adheres to team delivery/release process and cadence pertaining to code deployment and release</li><li>Contributes to story refinement and definition of requirementsSkills:</li><li>Coding</li><li>Testing</li><li>Active Listening</li><li>Effective Communication</li><li>Change Management</li><li>Problem-solvingRequired Background:Must be a current Year Up intern with Bank of AmericaShift:1st shift (United States of America)Hours Per Week:40Learn more about this role Software Engineer I</li></ul>

title: Software Developer - Chicago- C#/.NET
description: <ul><li>Lead developers working in C#, ASP.NET, .Net Core, JavaScript |Translate business requirements or needs into actionable software development<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client was founded over 20 years ago in the Spectator Sports industry, gearing their platform to serve a wide array of youth sports organizations across the US. They're currently the leading provider of technology solutions for all of the youth sports teams in the US, operating web and mobile platforms with over 4M on-boarded users. Their main challenge now is merging their technology to integrate with a company they acquired, while continuing to maintain operation of their platforms with minimal downtime. These are high impact projects that enrich the experiences of youth athletes, and simplify scheduling, planning, and making payments for parents<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Lead developers working in C#, ASP.NET, JavaScript - with the opportunity to jump in and code wherever necessary.</li><li>Translate business requirements or needs into actionable software development road maps and architecture.</li><li>Remain up to date with development breakthroughs and follows best practices.</li><li>Lead all discussions involving future developments, gaps in technology, external vendors and managing current software vendors.</li><li>Use, rework, and adapt existing web applications for mobile apps.</li><li>Create and test software prototypes when needed.</li><li>Perform daily stand-ups with team members to ensure optimal success and efficiency.</li><li>Take charge of development team without needing micromanagement from upper leadership.<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>5+ years of progressive experience in software development</li><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field.</li><li>Strong proficiency with C#, ASP.NET.</li><li>Strong profiency with JavaScript (React Native)</li><li>Experience using SQL databases - either relational and/or non-relational experience.</li><li>Experience working with REST APIs.</li><li>Strong attention to detail, always looking to create robust solutions that minimize excess redundancies.</li><li>Excellent troubleshooting and communication skills.</li><li>Clear documentation.</li><li>A desire to have an impact on the world with the software being developed.</li><li>Interest in a hybrid model in the Highland Park office up to twice a week.</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br></strong><ul><li>Base salary very open for the right candidate, up to 190K depending on experience.</li><li>Affordable comprehensive health-care plans, with more than 80% of out of pocket costs covered.</li><li>401k with 4% company match, no waiting period for matched contributions.</li><li>Unlimited Paid Time Off program, with no expectations, thresholds, or strings attached (avg 5 weeks off)</li><li>Office closed last 2 weeks of the calendar year.</li><li>Person first model, i.e. you're a person before you're a developer allowing flexibility for when life just happens.</li><li>Dynamic culture, tech minded individuals looking to make a difference with their coding.</li><li>Mentorship, management, and leadership opportunities within.</li><li>On-boarding program to make the transition period run smoothly.</li><li>Optional outings to visit Chicago Sports teams, games, press events, networking events.<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Daniela Rodríguez Flores<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-052023-6055700</strong>

title: ServiceNow Solutions Engineer ITSM
description: Take your career to the next level as an embedded software engineer, using your expertise in embedded C and MATLAB/Simulink to develop advanced features for the off-highway autonomous vehicle industry and push the technology of flagship vehicles such as tractors, harvesters, combines, and excavators to the next level.<br><ul><li>Your Responsibilities:*</li><li>Design, develop, and test software for enterprise programming and infrastructure solutions</li><li>Operate in a scrum team environment on varying project scope and direction from a project lead</li><li>Support the team with concept, development and testing of solutions</li><li>Software:*</li><li>Embedded C/C++</li><li>MATLAB/Simulink</li><li>Qualifications:*</li><li>Demonstrated capability in software product development using C++, C, Python and scripting languages</li><li>Training or experience with Object-Oriented Analysis/Design (OOA/D) and multi-threaded systems</li><li>Experience that demonstrates you are a self-starter, and able to work well without close direction</li><li>Demonstrated capability performing in an engineering team environment and interfacing with engineers and personnel of other disciplines</li><li>Minimum of 2 years of software industry experience<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: SOFTWARE DEVELOPER (contract)
description: <ul><li>Fun office environment |Flexible hybrid schedule<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client is an industry leader in the manufacturing space for structural steel and plate fabrication. Having been around for over 100 years, this is a sustainable team in a sustainable industry. <strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Write correct and clean code; consistently upholds &amp; exemplifies stated best practices.</li><li>Participate actively in the design of new technical features.</li><li>Know when to ask for help in order to maximize workflow and if needed get unblocked.</li><li>Able to take ownership of small-to-medium features from technical design through completion.</li><li>Be capable of prioritizing tasks while avoiding getting caught up in insignificant details.</li><li>Ability to become self-sufficient in an area of the system with a high-level understanding of other components.</li><li>Capable of providing support for their system/platform area, including systems that they are not familiar with.<br><br></li></ul><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>Lives in Chicago</li><li>Bachelor's Degree or above in Computer Science or related field</li><li>At least 4-7 years of experience as a Software Developer / Engineer</li><li>Strong experience with Python and C#/ .NET</li><li>Ability to work in a fast paced environment</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br></strong><ul><li>Great opportunity for growth as this will be the first of internal engineer hires.</li><li>Competitve salary to be based on experience and interviews.</li><li>Excellent benefits package</li><li>Hybrid work structure (2-3 days/week in office)</li><li>Medical, dental, heathcare coverage</li><li>Generous PTO<br><br></li></ul><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong>Please feel free to email your updated resume, a summary of your relevant experience, and 2 or more references to SeanStanton @ MichaelPage.US.com<br><br><strong>Contact: Sean Stanton<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-052023-6055320</strong>

title: Software Engineer I
description: Venture backed DeFi startup is hiring for a Senior Full Stack Software Engineer!This Jobot Job is hosted by: Sydney WeaverAre you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.Salary: $100,000 - $180,000 per yearA bit about us:Venture backed DeFi startup is hiring for a full stack software engineer! I've also placed folks with this CEO and they've had excellent feedback on the culture and scope of work. They are building marketplaces that increase the efficiency and liquidity in decentralized markets as the first protocol to power decentralized order flow markets. They are the first movers working on an incredibly important unsolved problem in DeFi and their team background is well-poised for solving that problem quickly and correctly, with backgrounds in high-frequency trading, financial markets, and FAANG tech at companies. They are committed to bringing the same levels of market sophistication seen in traditional markets to decentralized markets in order to enable the next wave of crypto adoption through building beautifully designed decentralized software and crypto user experiences.Why join us?Great Benefits, Remote Work, Growth Opportunity, Great Culture, PTO, 401K, and much more!Job DetailsSkillset &amp; Responsibilities 3-6+ years of software engineering experience BS Degree in Computer Science or related STEM Ability to learn new programming languages and frameworks quickly Experience in TypesScript, React, Node.js, &amp; GraphQL An understanding of web application architectures and programming paradigms Excellent software engineering workflows and practices (e.g. git, CI, unit testing, etc.) Strong verbal and written communication skillsPluses Industry experience in Blockchain, Web3, or related Experience with the Solana programming paradigm, and the Anchor framework Web3 or related experienceInterested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button. Fullstack Developer

title: .Net Architect
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p>At Chamberlain Group (CG), we hire smart, creative people to work on next-gen products for a connected world. We are passionate technologists with bold ideas and diverse perspectives. Our Engineering teams—spanning mechanical, firmware, machine learning and AI, cloud, and mobile technologies and more—reinvent access by combining hardware with cutting-edge, cloud-based solutions to create a safer, smarter customer experience. At CG, we encourage flexibility, fun, and a healthy work/life balance, including remote options.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is a global leader in access solutions with top brands, such as LiftMaster and Chamberlain, found in millions of homes, businesses, and communities worldwide. As a leader in the Smart Home industry, we boast one of the largest IoT install bases, with innovative products consisting of cameras, locks, card readers, garage door openers, gates and more, all powered by our myQ digital ecosystem.<p><br></p>This role will conduct the day-to-day tasks of managing the MyQ service in all environments (production and non-production) and coordinate work with some of the less experienced department team members. Daily work activity coordinating the work as the "ops member" of one or two Scrum teams. The role is responsible for system support, administration, governance and operations to ensure best possible Quality of Service (QOS) goals are met or exceeded. Communication and coordination with myQ stakeholders, other DevOps team members, the NOC crew and the development teams will occur daily. The role will take turns in the on-call rotation schedule for 24x7 operations and incident response (tier 2 and 3 functions). The position acts as a central information and task execution point working on the myQ/Connected Solutions platform. System operations are run entirely in the public cloud.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field</li><li>3 years in system operations, technical operations or DevOps role for websites and/or mobile applications</li><li>1+ experience working with a 24x7x365 service organization</li><li>Experience working to support consumer-facing products and mobile phone applications</li><li>1 year+ operations experience working on public cloud infrastructure</li><li>Able to code in C++, Python, PowerShell and experience source code control platforms and processes</li><li>Knowledge of good coding practices and standards, including object-oriented design, code refactoring, and code documentation</li><li>Experience with Source Code Management Tools (e.g. Git, TFS, VSTS, RTC)</li><li>Working in Agile Scrum and Kanban SLDC methodologies.</li><li>Communications skills for working closely with Project Managers, Product Owners, Technical Leads, Scrum Masters and individual contributors</li><li>Willing to take ownership of service reliability and operations. Must be ready and available to respond 24x7x365 in cases of service incidents and disruptions</li><li>Willing to “roll up the sleeves” and work with the team to continuously improve Quality Of Service</li><li>Working knowledge of Internet protocols and web server software and communications, including HTTP, TCP, UDP, Web Sockets, Windows Server, IIS.</li><li>Experience with the Atlassian JIRA and Confluence tools for ticket, task, and knowledge management.</li><li>Operator experience with monitoring tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, Monitis, Nagios, DynaTrace, App Dynamics. Administrator level experience is desired.</li><li>Able to write SQL queries to extract content from database tables.</li><li>Understands load balancers and operational issue surround traffic management. Desire a demonstrated ability to manage load balancer pools.</li><li>Organized, self-motivated, able to multi-task, able to get the message and needs of operations heard by the technologists, engineering and marketing/ business teams.</li><li>Able to effectively analyze unexpected problems by locating patterns in the data and underlying causes.</li><li>Attention to detail, quality, responsiveness and efficiency.</li><li>PowerShell user - needs to be able take over script libraries with goal to keep them current/relevant.</li><li>Fluent in MS Office Suite</li><li>Demonstrated success operating a complex system</li><li>Ability to work inside a matrix organizations</li><li>Hybrid cloud data center operations</li><li>Desire some Public Cloud platform project and resource administration experience (PaaS, SaaS and IaaS).</li><li>Familiarity with security tools (IPD/IPS) and best practices in defending against “bad actors”.</li><li>Understands AMQP technology and messaging services operations</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Manage existing as well as undertake minor development tasks or modifications of the existing monitoring frameworks, monitoring dashboards and monitoring data history archive in support of Service Level Agreements and Quality of Service reporting; deliver the “three nines” uptime by forming collaboration teams aligned to the SLA/SLO goal</li><li>Define, manage, and execute operational tests and processes to confirm system health or status using custom tools and 3rd party monitoring applications</li><li>Participate in and be SME to multiple technical topics or systems during incident response calls ensuring immediate mitigation and then ultimate resolution to the root causes of all service interruptions. Is part of the rotational schedule of the on-call support team with 24x7 on call assignment every few weeks</li><li>Collaborate, consult, coordinate task level work with developers or scrum teams on matter of capacity expansion or new feature deployment</li><li>Coordinate with internal customers to discuss the operational dimensions and system health for current or new releases of myQ/Connected Products platform; coordinate with call center, security team or other scrum team members</li><li>Be able to work closely with a tight knit group of developers; Work using agile methodologies; Be able to identify risks with platform operations; Participate in peer reviews and pull requests; Analyze requirements, collaborate with architect and leads to produce thoughtful software designs that ensure</li><li>principals and standards are maintained across your code; Capable of leading and contributing to technical discussions</li><li>Perform daily / weekly/ monthly reporting duties as directed by supervisor; conduct data extractions in support of QOS investigations, RCAs, business opportunities and user communications. Author necessary Root Cause Analysis (RCA) documents after service breaks; follow up on corrective actions items determined by RCA meetings.</li><li>Support the Scrum Team with defect/task/story tickets research for pre-existing bugs or undesired system behavior</li><li>Manage/deliver the communications materials as instructed when notification to stakeholder and partner teams occur regarding about planned and unplanned events of the Connected Solutions platform</li><li>Responsible for complying with the security requirements set forth by the Information Security team and the established ISO 27001 Security Roles, Responsibilities, and Authorities Document found in the ISMS Document Library</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect CGI’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

title: Hybrid - Software Engineer (React Native)
description: <p><strong>Role </strong>– Sr Java FullStack Developer</p><p><strong>Technology </strong>– Java, Spring Boot, Mongo DB</p><p><strong>Location </strong>– Chicago, IL</p><p><br></p><p>Job Description :</p><p><br></p><p>Job Description :</p><p>Infosys is seeking <strong>Sr. Java Full Stack Developer. </strong>This position will work with key collaborators and apply technical proficiency across different stages of the Software Development Life Cycle including requirements elicitation, application architecture definition and design, play a meaningful role in creating the high-level design artifacts, deliver high quality code results for a module, lead validation for all types of testing and support activities related to implementation, transition and warranty. This is an opportunity to be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued.</p><p><strong>Required Qualifications:</strong></p><ul><li>Candidate must be located within commuting distance of <strong>Chicago, IL /Richardson, TX </strong>or be willing to relocate to the area. This position may require travel in the US.</li><li>Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.</li><li>At least 4 years of Information Technology experience.</li><li>Experience with Java8/J2EE, Microservices, Spring Boot and frameworks like Spring, Spring-boot, Hibernate1.x version/JPA, web-services, REST services, API Security, OAuth, Spring Security Framework etc.</li><li>At least 1 year of Experience with React JS/Angular.</li><li>Experience working with Pivotal cloud Foundry (PCF) or Azure.</li><li>Experience in software development life cycle.</li><li>Experience in Project life cycle activities on development and maintenance projects.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Preferred Qualifications:</strong></p><ul><li>Ability to work in team in diverse/ multiple partners.</li><li>Preferred Lead experience of minimum 3-4 members team.</li><li>At least 2-4 years of experience in Design and architecture review.</li><li>DevOps / GitHub / Deployment and good understanding of Jenkins and manual deployments.</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Experience and desire to work in a Global delivery environment.</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong></p><ul><li>Ensure Sprint dedication and release goals are met, understand program/ project objectives, and meet the release goals.</li><li>Metrics to be met as per agreed SLA for the team.</li><li>Own the team on technical guidance, mentoring as needed.</li><li>Coordinate with offshore team, client team and take end to end responsibility of project delivery.</li><li>Customer management, weekly reports/ governance, and cadence with ITPMs, Architects as needed.</li></ul><p></p>

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: Contract | $50-70/hr | Chicago,Illinois<br><br>Our client, a non-profit organization based in the NorthWest Suburbs, is seeking an experienced Full Stack Developer to join their team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing applications using C# and .NET, with a focus on creating robust code. The releases of these applications will be carried out using Azure cloud infrastructure building pipelines.<br><br>We are looking for a seasoned developer who possesses strong skills in SQL server. This expertise will greatly contribute to the success of the individual in this position.<br><br><strong><u>Required Skills &amp; Experience<br></u></strong><ul><li>6+ years of experience with C# and .NET technology(.NET 6, MVC 5) </li><li>Full-stack development experience with JavaScript(Angular 12+) </li><li>Expert at working with SQL server </li><li>Skilled at working with ORM like Entity, LINQ </li><li>CI/CD experience, building pipelines </li><li>Ability to work in Scrum environment </li><li>Great communication skills both written and verbal.<br></li></ul>Desired Skills &amp; Experience <ul><li>.NET core, .NET 6 experience </li><li>Experience with Azure tools Azure DevOps, Azure Service Bus CosmoDB, Azure Data Factory </li><li>JavaScript experience using Angular<br></li></ul>What You Will Be Doing <ul><li>30% Frontend work </li><li>70% Backend work<br></li></ul>The Offer <ul><li>You will receive the following benefits: </li><li>Medical Insurance </li><li>Dental Benefits </li><li>Vision Benefits </li><li>Paid Time Off </li><li>401K with 10% match </li><li>Wellness Benefit </li><li>Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the US on a full-time basis now and in the future LI-VD2<br></li></ul>Motion Recruitment Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including EOE Protected Veterans/Disability/Women. All applicants must be currently authorized to work on a full-time basis in the country for which they are applying, and no sponsorship is currently available. Employment is subject to the successful completion of a pre-employment background screening including a criminal check. Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process as required under Motion Recruitment Employment Accommodation policy. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.

title: Full Stack Software Engineer
description: Hi,<p><br></p>Hope you’re staying safe and healthy! I sourced your profile from one of the job boards while looking for <strong>“</strong><strong>Java Developer”</strong>. I feel that you’d be a good fit for the position I’m currently recruiting for. So, I’m writing to you in regard to an exciting role we have available with one of our clients, for the position of <strong>“</strong><strong>Java Developer”</strong> based out of <strong>Chicago IL 60603</strong>.<p><br></p>Here’s the detailed job description for your reference. Please have a look at it and let me know your thoughts. If interested, please send me your updated resume, and feel free to reach me at <strong>703-468-1406</strong> . Or let me know what time works best for you so we can further discuss this in detail.<p><br></p><strong>Job Title: </strong><strong>Java Developer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Chicago IL 60603</strong><p><br></p><strong>Type: Contract To Hire</strong><p><br></p><strong>Roles and Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree (or equivalent experience) in Computer Science/Engineering</li><li>2+ years of experience in Java backend development and framework such as Java/J2EE/Java Sprint Boots</li><li>Experience with unit testing such as junit</li><li>Must have Solid understanding of object oriented, multi-thread design methodologies and J2EE design patterns</li><li>1+ years of experience in relational database experience such as Oracle or PostgreSQL</li><li>Advanced knowledge of application, data and infrastructure architecture disciplines. </li><li>Understanding of architecture and design across all systems</li><li>Knowledge of industry wide technology trends and best practices</li><li>Ability to work in large, collaborative teams to achieve organizational goals, and passionate about building an innovative culture</li><li>Working proficiency in developmental toolsets such as Ant, Maven, Gradle, Git, Jenkins</li><li>Experience in troubleshooting issues</li><li>Good communication skills</li><li>Able to organize and handle technical discussion with architects and Sr. Leaders</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desired:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Working proficiency with micro-services architecture</li><li>Exposure to Kubernetes, Kafka messaging,</li><li>Exposure to AWS cloud services like Aurora PostgreSQL, EKS, IAM etc</li></ul><p><br></p>Pay Range: $40-$80<p><br></p>The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment. Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision as well as 401K contributions.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: The Quality Engineer will be responsible for managing all functional and automated testing processes in support of business intelligence development efforts at Oak Street Health. From design to implementation, you will partner with our stellar engineering, product, and design teams in a fast-paced, agile environment to transform ideas into a reality. Utilizing modern methodologies and open source tools, you will be empowered to push the boundaries of Quality Engineering as we seek to deliver applications that will directly and immediately impact the experience of our teams and our patients. This role will handle the creation of all test scripts, the documentation of all test cases and identification of bugs across ETL development and reporting. The Quality Engineer will manage the identification of bugs and assist in the prioritization of bug fixes.<br><br>There is no better time to join our rapidly growing team at Oak Street Health. We can't think of a mission any more motivating; and, with your help, we can drive change in healthcare for the patients that need us most.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Contribute in all aspects of SDLC process( SCRUM, Design, Code, Test, Deploy &amp; Maintain)<br><br>Review and analyze business and system requirements / specifications<br><br>Design test plans, scenarios, scripts, and procedures<br><br>Execute test cases (manual or automated) and log test results<br><br>Work with the development and product team to correct bugs / errors and identify requirement updates / clarifications<br><br>Support, design, develop, and enhance test processes and reporting for QA processes<br><br>Develop and maintain automation frameworks and solutions for ETL and data architecture<br><br>Automate tests to facilitate regression testing<br><br>Provide testing SME guidance to QA engineers<br><br>Other duties as assigned

title: Fullstack Developer
description: Prestigious Financial Institution is currently seeking a ServiceNow Solutions Engineer. Candidate will provide services to an existing Platform team to architect, design, develop and deploy solutions utilizing the ServiceNow platform. Their deliverables will be focused on development and delivery of value-added integration, out-of-box configuration and consultative services for low code software development. They will collaborate with a team of Engineers to design, deploy and integrate various product capabilities.Successful execution of delivery on Enterprise Technology Solution epics in-scope for enabling IT Service Management and Security Operations within the ServiceNow platform. This person will provide testing and support for ServiceNow upgrade that we have scheduled in early November, where all functionality has been tested/validated for User Acceptance and any bugs have been fixed. Additionally, Architecture/Designs related to Security Operations and the ITSM in the cloud for our roadmap.Responsibilities:Contribute to design, technical direction, and architecture with various teams to build fit for purpose solutionsParticipates in code reviews, proactively identifying and mitigating potential issues and defects as well as assisting with continuous improvementFollows agreed upon SDLC procedures to ensure that all information system products and services meet both explicit and implicit quality standards, end-user functional requirements, architectural standards, performance requirements, audit requirements, security rules are upheld, and external facing reporting is representedWrites unit and integration tests to maintain quality technology improvementsPerforms application and project risk analysis and recommends quality improvementsManage Production Support on system functionality and provide fixes as requiredQualifications: 5+ years of experience in implementing ServiceNow or similar platforms for ITSM, SecOps and/or GRC/IRM modules3+ years of experience with JavascriptExperience with RESTful APIs and JSONAbility to write clean, bug-free code that is easy to understand and easily maintainableStrong understanding of CMDB, including importing customer dataExperience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), Agile/Scrum, and DevSecOps methodologiesBS degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, similar technical field<p><br></p>ServiceNow Solutions Engineer ITSM

title: Engineer 2, DevOps
description: <strong>About US:</strong><p><br></p>LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 750 clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world. Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen &amp; Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale.<p><br></p><strong>Location: Riverwoods, IL - Hybrid</strong><p><br></p><strong>Rate - $55/hr - $60/hr</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>A Full Stack Engineer will own one or more components of our web applications, used by internal and external stakeholders in multi-time zones with different internet speed distribution. The role holder should be comfortable around both front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks and third-party libraries. A Full Stack Engineer will be part of a cross-functional team that's responsible for the entire software development life cycle, from conception to deployment. title: Full Stack Software Engineer
description: A rapidly growing software company is hiring for fully remote engineers. New projects and development in Typescript and Python. Great room for growth and benefits!This Jobot Job is hosted by: Alex DickinsonAre you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.Salary: $125,000 - $175,000 per yearA bit about us:If you're interested in solving challenging analytical and data driven problems, this is a great role for you. This company is an up and coming SaaS provider in the risk and insurance space with an incredibly bright and talented team. They are extremely collaborative and believe in using the best tool for the job. There is room for growth, interesting projects and a ton to learn in this environment!Why join us?Interesting problems to solveLong road map of work and customers, stable financial situation Fully remote work culture Strong compensation and benefits offeringJob Details Design, develop, and maintain web applications using Typescript, Python, Django, Node, React, and other relevant technologies. Collaborate with other engineers, product managers, and designers to ensure the successful delivery of software products. Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code that adheres to industry standards. Participate in code reviews and provide feedback to other team members. Continuously improve the quality of our software products through testing, debugging, and optimization. Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in software development.Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button. Full Stack Software Engineer
